Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then take it with the forceps and cut it from the roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you suspend it with an anchor, and excoriate it, and then close it; and adjust the plate with suture, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter .li.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the section of abscess which happens from a boil that happens to the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	And it happens to some men growths in the bellies of those and in other parts of the body of those, the ones that are called fungals for similarity to those with fungi, of which the root is subtle and the head of it is thick; and already the lips of those are converses, and it is of those that is small, and it is of those that is very magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in the belly of him were two parts which were more like fungi, and there was no difference between those white, of fine root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were turned inwards and were splitting, and humidity was running from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I incised those and brought out in one of them a weight of about eighteen ounces. And the other about six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in the incision of them is that you consider then if the patient is humid, and the color of the boil is white, humid, of subtle root; then you should cut it with a spatula wide, and be in your presence cauterize in the fire, because many times the secretion of it is expelled a lot of blood; and if you see the blood, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient pale and fearful, guard yourself from incision with iron; but then take a leaden weight recently made, and strengthen it with that boil, the manner of which is that we have said; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then adjust in the stricture of the lead thread; therefore, do not cease to strengthen the lead more and more in the boil, until it is cut and falls by itself its work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the boil is of thick root, then in the incision of it there is some cause of fear and of terror, and more so in the one that is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But possibly it is that you should incise the majority of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then cure it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And guard yourself that you do not presume to incise those that are of dusky color, of little feeling, of light regard, because those are cancerous abscesses.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come with a remembrance of cancer to that.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter .lii.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of the prominence of the umbilicus.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The prominence of the umbilicus is made by many causes; or by fissures of the fascia which is above the belly, and there comes out the web or intestine according to what it should be in the other ruptures; or by blood which flows from the vein or artery according to what is said before, or by contracted wind in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by fissure of the fascia and by the protrusion of the web, then the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the body; and it is lion its pain, and then appears from various positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by the egress of the intestine, then the situation of it with that which we have recounted, of more vehement diversity, and when you press it with your hands it is hidden, and then it returns; and very much is with it so, and it is magnified much by the introduction of bath and vehement work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by humidity, then it is lion and is not hidden when you press with your hand, nor is it constricted, nor is it believed.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by blood, then with these signs appears the abscess to blackness declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by flesh nothing, then the abscess is serious, thick and hard, and it is placed according to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by wind, then the touch of it is lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider then if the prominence of the umbilicus is by blood of artery, or of vein, or by wind; then you should be prohibited from the cure of it, because in that there is fear and terror as you have been taught in the chapter in which I have said the abscesses by artery and by vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to the hernia or the fabric, then order the patient to hold his leg, and be standing extended; and then feel with your fingers around the entire navel, and then order him to lie between his hands on his back, and then surround it with a spatula broad around the navel on the spot which you have marked with the finger; and then extend the majority of the abscess to the upper parts with a large hook; and then tie it around with a strong thread or with a lead and the manner of tying decent.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then cut the edge of the extended abscess over the ligament and introduce your finger into that incision and feel for the hernia; and if you have found it or kept it by the ligament, then you extract it and push the hernia to the sides of the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the fabric, then take it with a hook; and cut away the superfluities of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then surround that spot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put in those two strong threads and introduce the two needles into the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a manner of cross, which you make penetrate; and then strengthen the abscess in four parts on the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and leave the place until the stretched flesh can fall by itself; or cut it when it is subtle and can be, and then care for it with water that is customary of the ointments until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is of flesh nothing in it or by humidity, then order that you excavate the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or the humidity, which you find in it, and then care for it with water that is customary and that consolidates the place.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter .liii.
De curacio de cranc.	Of the cure of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	As we have said, in the division, of the species of cancer and in what manner is its cure with medicines, and that it is  avoidable in it the cure with iron because it is not ulcerated; and we have said cancer generated in the marrow and caution of the cure of it.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes cancer is in a place where it is possible the eradication of it, as of the cancer which is in the nipples or in the groin and their likeness of the limbs allocated to extract all of that, and especially when it is beginning small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is antiquated and is large, do not order to it, because I have not been able to heal from that ulcer nor have I seen another, nor that has come to it.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation in it is when it is allocated as we have said, is that you precede and leave the patient and purge of black bile sometimes, and then bleed him, if a manifest repletion is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with the preparation in which he is located with the operation, and then prohibit in the tract hooks which order to it; and then concave from all parts with the good saw careful excavation until no remnant of the roots of it remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood run, and do not cut it lightly, and express the places, and wipe away the thick blood all with your hand or with an instrument with which is at your disposal of the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if to you makes contrariety of thick blood incision of vein or of artery, then cauterize that until the flow of the blood is ceased, and then care for it with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter .liv.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure of hydrops.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division, of the species of hydrops of the water, and the signs of each species, of the cure of it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that one which is cured with iron is only the species of althitas alone, and it is not approached with iron to the species of tympanistres nor to the species of hypoarcha, because that is mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already medicated this species of hydrops tympanistres with medicines and do not confer your medication, then consider, that if the patient already is achieved debility, or is with that other illness another hydrops, as if it is in his cough or body of belly and similar to those, then guard yourself that you do not medicate him with iron, because fear is upon it.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient of exuberant virtue, and in him there is no other illness but hydrops so alone, and not a child nor old, then the manner of the operation of it is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and the minister then expresses the belly of him with his hand, expelling the water to the side below the pubic bone, and then take a spatula spines according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	be of two parts sharp long, of sharp extremity as a spatula; but however be in it some shortness little by little, so that in the operation with it you do not pass into the hernia, and that you lead it.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydrops is of part of the hernias, because then order that you with the section you stay away from the navel for the quantity of three digits to the sides below, in the right of him over the pubic bone.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydrops is by illness of the liver, then your section be left of the navel for three digits.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of him is by the measles, then his section shall be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not make the incision on the side where the patient wants to lie, so that the superfluities do not flow to that place freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument the whole bone, and then insert into that incision, and raise your hand with the spatula between the bone and the skin, and you exfoliate that; and if the quantity of a nail or thereabouts.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the skin until the spatula reaches the desired location, and it is the place of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and insert an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver cannula; it is made of silver or brass or lead, to which in the lower part of it there is a small hole, and on the sides of it there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and the end of it is made blunt according to the manner of a feather, as sometimes:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the end of it most sovereign is an armlet, because when the instrument reaches the water, then it immediately rises over the instrument, therefore evacuates the water in the middle quantity, because if you evacuate more than that in the hour, very soon the patient will die by the resolution of his animal spirit, or you will bring him to the five-pi that is approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that according to the quantity of its virtue and according to what the dispositions of the patient signify to you from the virtue of its pulse and from the goodness of it.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then extract the instrument, and retain the water which is the cause because it is immediately retained by the bone which retains the hole that is on the skin of it and I recommend to you that you pierce that according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the instrument the other day if the patient tolerates it, and extract a small quantity of water, and do water for some days with caution, and guard yourself from error so that there does not remain much water.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear about the patient, and let out a large quantity of water, then cure him with burial in hot sand, and bathe him in sweat, and in the sunlight wait for a long time; and cure him with drying medicines until he is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize on the stomach, and the measles and the fig, approach the extraction of the water, according to what I have recounted in that which is preceding.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lv.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the cure of children who are born with the places of the urine unpierced.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some of the children are born from the womb of their mother and the head of their mixture is not pierced (or it is straight hole or it is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to repair with the perforation of it as soon as it is born with a very fine spatula according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then place in the hole a fine lead nail and tie that, and keep it for three days or for four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, it will be re-opened and urinate; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not place the lead, it is already possible that the urine which goes over the place, does not let this opening.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that one of whom the hole is straight be medicated with a lead nail, as we have said, for too many days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in which the hole is not in its place, are ledgers, the cause because of those, the one who is born and the hole is the end of the head of the vagina because he cannot urinate to the sides of his, until he elevates the vagina with his hand to the upper parts; and it is not to his generation, because his sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a very bad illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation in him is that the patient be turned on his back, and then extend the head of the vagina of him with your left hand with vehement extraction, and inscribe the head of the head of the vagina of the place of the perpucii with a sharp spatula, as it is inscribed of a feather, or that you do not scrape any part, so that the middle of him comes to resemble the head of the vagina and that the hole falls in the middle place according to what is necessary.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And guard yourself in your operation of flux of blood, because many times accidents happen in this; and pause yourself to him with the water that you have separated the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter .lvi.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of albater which happens in the prepuce at the head of the vagina and of corruption and blackness and adherence of the prepuce of the head of the vagina.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this albater happens in the vagina and it is a prominence of bad flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of that one is malignant and the other is non-malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	The non-malignant, because you suspend it with a fine unci and cut that until that whole thing is gone; and then place on that a poultice submerged in Egyptian ointment; and then that, cure him with diaphicon ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the albater is malignant, of bad color, then because you administer cauterization to the incision of it and the base of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if there is a tear in the foreskin of the uncircumcised penis, and one part of the tear is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you must treat the tear that is inside first while it is still fresh; and then you treat the one outside, because when you treat the outside one at the same time as the inside one, it is not certain that it will not be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if there are accidents in the genitals and foreskin, blackness and corruption, then you must cleanse all that which is already corrupted and which is going to be corrupted or which is already corrupted; and then apply a poultice on that with honey, which is mixed with flour of the rind of millet and of herbs, well crushed and sifted.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And treat that with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is a flow of blood, then administer a lunar cautery according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because a cautery is useful in two dispositions at once, so it is for a flow of blood and for the plague when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corrupted and destroyed all at once, then you must introduce into the flesh of the foreskin a lead pipe so that the patient urinates through that.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not happen except in the one whose foreskin is his, and on which circumcision is not required; and when adhesion happens because of plague or abscess) you must excoriate with a blunt spatula until it is dissolved the ligament and the head of the penis is freed from all sides.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them delicately, then you must excoriate with a spatula some cause of the head of the penis and the foreskin, and thus it is because the foreskin, when it is thin, easily perforates with its thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a thread of linen, the one which has already been soaked in cold water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then it should be treated with a styptic until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .lvii.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and the cure of what happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other plagues: however, since it is of our operation and our will, and it is done to those of our own, it is necessary that we assign in that better operation and easier way less loss to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, I say that the ancients did not write about circumcision in some of their books, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, the cause of which is that I have found the majority of the artificers and barbers use circumcision and purification with a knife and with torches; and they use ligatures with thread and incisions with the fingernail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already tried all these manners and have not found better purification with scissors, with a ligature with thread than with purification with the fingernail, because many times the cord escapes the lower part, because the foreskin has two tunics, and the tunic remains further down, and very easily it is forced to another incision and certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in purification which is done by alphecati, and is digital, of which the barbers use, the incision of the extremity of the male member is not guaranteed, because very easily it enters into the opening of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the fingernail, very easily it obscures iron and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the cord of the child is short by nature, and many times it appears in such a manner that there is no need for purification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification which is done with scissors and ligatures with thread, the goodness, experience has shown me, because the scissors are of proportional incision, because the sharpness that is below is as the sharpness that is above; and therefore as you press your hand so proportionally to two sharpnesses, and you incise according to a comparison in one time; and it is done compression of the thread with a figure containing the cord of the penis entirely, with which there is no error at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you make the child lie down mostly if it is of those that understand a little, that you do nothing but that you tie the thread in its penis only, and that you leave that in for another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then do that to make him happy in all that manner that is possible to him according to what he receives in his understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him lie down between your arms, prepared, and do not be seen by him; and hide the scissors in your hand or below your leg, that the child does not see them nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then introduce your hand into his penis and blow into the cord, and pull that until it is emerged the head of the penis, and then purify that of what is attached to it of dirt.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the place signed with thread double, and below that one little the second ligature, and then put your finger on the place of the ligature below with good retention, and incise between the two ligatures.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then elevate the cord slightly and extract the head of the penis; and let the blood run little by little, because it is better; and place powder above and on the powder place a cloth in which is spread a mixture of honey with water, mixed with fresh rose oil; and leave that on it for another day; and treat that with cure until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for modification, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let one pair of limbs be blunt and the other sharp, so that the ram of the key does not come out, and the length of the two points be like the length of two equal hand spans.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in modification is when too much of the intrinsic tendon is removed, or a part of it should be cut.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, as you extend that one with your fingernail in front of the abscess and cut it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then extract that one with an instrument and cut it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed, and that which is swollen remains, then you should let it go until the abscess softens, and excoriate it with ease, and cut it according to what you have prepared.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And guard yourself from the head of the abscess, for it would not be good for you.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore cure it with that which the plague consolidates from the powders which we have recommended in the treatise of powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is cut from the tendon beyond measure, and it is swollen in the parts above, it will not be good for you.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	But cure it with that which we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .lviii.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by an obstruction made by a stone or by a clot, or by a tumor or by a carbuncle, and similar to those of which we have said of the ways of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and the retention of it is due to a stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then the patient should be bent over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place his feet on his buttocks and extend his belly from the part above his buttocks, and the patient strains as much as is possible for him.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, then the neck of the bladder is constricted so that the expulsion of the stone is towards the rear parts, so that the urine is released.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with what we have said and the cause is very vehement on the patient, then you should administer an extraction from him with an instrument which is called a syringe, of which this is the shape: It should be of silver and be a subtle cone, as well as a pipe of bird bone with the subtlety of a ray long in the likeness of a palm and a half, to which there is a subtle pipe at the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the emission of the urine by this is that you take the flexible tube and tie it in the middle with a thread or cord for a good binding; and insert the ends of the tube into the part below the syringe, and cut with the forceps if there is any superfluous cause of the thread, but introduce it into the pipe with vehemence, and then insert the syringe with border and with album of egg.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on his back, and massage his bladder and the abscess with oil of roses, and olive oil, and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the syringe with ease until it reaches the bottom of the abscess; and then double the abscess above at the level of the navel; and then push the syringe into it; and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and that the patient should be made to feel the cause, and it is not done according to this order, but the meat in which it goes is tortuous.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the tube with the thread little by little, so that the urine moistens the thread.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract it and do for the cure of urine, and use the syringe, do not cease to do this and use the syringe until the bladder is emptied and the patient feels relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with clampcedra and with similar instruments which are according to this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there occurs in the bladder ulceration or abscess, or a clot in it, or it is constricted by a tumor, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then it is done with an instrument which is called a clampcedra, and this is the shape of it:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	...but in the middle of it is closed, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it there are three tubes: two on one side, as well as the other.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is the concave place, in which the water is poured, and according to the quantity that it is poured, it is added, until when any cause is drawn from the humidities, it is drawn, and when it is expelled, it is drawn with water, and when it is expelled long, according to what the clampcedra does with which naphtha is poured into the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, as you want to pour humidities into the bladder, insert the end of the clampcedra into the humidity, and draw with it the water that is poured into the upper parts, so that the humidity is drawn into the concavity of the clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the end of the clampcedra into the abscess as we have recommended in the syringe; and then push the humidity with the water that you push it with, so that that humidity reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Shape of the clyster subtle am which the bladder is clystered, and that is the form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or lead, of which the head must be like a small feather, and below it a tube is attached.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder by the mouth, and place in it the moisture that you want to clysterize into the bladder, and then tie that between two with a strong double ligature, and heat that moisture over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then introduce the extremity of the clyster into the rectum.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then tightly press your hand on the bladder with the moisture and structure descending until the patient feels that the moisture has reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder, then you take a piece of parchment and make a circle from it; and pierce that throughout its entirety; and then insert a strong thread into those holes, so that it is rolled; and then attach the circle so that it is attached to the sofat, because you place in that the water that you want of the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that onto the instrument and do with it as you have done with the bladder, and express with your hand until the moisture reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the extraction of a stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stone and cure of it with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and the signs of that.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which catz operation with a hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I am narrating this with a manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly comes to children; and of the signs of it is that the urine that is issued from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in that sand; and the patient feels his rectum, and many times it pains, and then it is dressed; and with that you see the hole in the rectum in many of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier the healing of the children of that into which they have reached fourteen years; and it is difficult healing in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is milder for that which is among those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that from which the stone is larger and the healing is lighter; And if it is little, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore as we come to the healing of that, cove at the beginning of that which we modify the patient with the clyster which extracts all the wound which is in their bowels; because that wound sometimes prohibits the entrance of the stone and the inquiry of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then place the patient on their feet and sit them and make them groan so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or which jumps from that place or sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that cezer between your hands prepared, and the hands of it are left the things of it, so that the bladder is entirely made declining to the parts below.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then pierce that and all of that through.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel the stone in the space, then you take care immediately with a section over it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch all of it from below your touch, then cove that you anoint with oil your said index of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said middle if it is a young complete, and insert that into their rectum.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And pierce of the stone until it stays below your said.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And turn that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on that with your said, and expel that to the parts outside ves the place of which you the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister that presses the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand extends the genitals to the parts above, and with his other hand restrains the groin which is below the genitals, in part of the place where the section is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert a spatula well incident of which this is the form of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And cut in it the water that is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place,  leaning to the left side of the groin; and let the section be on that stone and your said be in the anus, and let it be a transverse section, so that the section outside be wide and inside narrow according to the quantity that is expelled of the stone be to it possible, and no greater, because very hard we compress your said which is in the anus the stone and it is thrown out of its faculty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that of the stone there is some to which so angle and margins, so that the extraction of it is made difficult by that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that one it is lion seeming to gland, and it is round, and it is made of it light extraction.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it is that one to which so angles and margins, adjust in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus thrown out, then cove that you engage upon that, or that you strengthen upon that with a decent gesture, the extremity of which is like a file with which you strengthen upon the stone, and do not escape from it; or that you insert below it a subtle instrument of curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot do it on that, then you enlarge the opening a little, and if you see a flow of blood, cut it off with vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the bladder is more than one, at the beginning you push your hand into the mouth of the bladder, and then cut into it; and then push a little bit in there; and similarly do so if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the bladder is very large, then ignorance is that you cut it open with a large incision, because it happens to the patient one of two causes: either it dies or it makes a continuous distillation of urine, because of which the place is not completely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer expulsion of it while it is thrown out, or engineer in the fracture of it with the forceps while it extracts that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with ointment of aloe and dragon's blood, and tighten that.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place on that cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rubbed oil and water, so that the abscess may be yielded.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then turn the patient onto their back, and do not untie the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that you have untied it, embrocate the place with water and a little oil, and then cure that with an enguent diafinicon and an enguent diabazilicon until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there happens a bad, putrid, and corrosive abscess, and of this sort as if the blood is in the bladder frozen, and because of it the urine is prohibited (and this is known by the egress of blood in urine), then therefore intervene your said in the wound and extract that blood, because if it remains it provokes the bladder to corruption of the bladder and its putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with vinegar, water, and salt, and in opposition to every kind, with that which convenes to it of the cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover during all the hours of the cure that you lie both things and adjust the medicines which are placed upon the place.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the bladder is small and is in the middle of the vagina, and it is put in it, and the emission of urine is prohibited, then cure that with water which I recommend before you arrive at the incision, because troops of times by this cure it is accused of incision; and already I have expressed this, and it is that you take a steel perforator, of which this is the shape of it:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extremity, sharp, put into a shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thread, and tie with it the vagina below the bladder so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then intervene the iron in the vagina, perforating with ease until the perforator comes to that bladder.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And revolve the perforator with your hand in that bladder little by little, and you perforate the perforation of it until you make that of the other part penetrate; because the urine is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand over that which is broken of the bladder from the side of the vagina, because that is broken, and is thrown out with the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not to your liking for any cause which prohibits you from it, then tie a thread below the bladder, and another thread above the bladder.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then cut into the bladder in that vagina between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract that.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligatures and modify the congealed blood, which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to tie a thread below the bladder, but only so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligature above, because when the thread is untied, the bladder returns to its place and covers the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And therefore it is necessary to you when you tie the thread above, that you elevate the bladder to the upper parts, or that you return to your compliment, and cover the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxi.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of the bladder from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Bladder in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a bladder is seen in any of those, then difficult is the cure of it, and it is prohibited by troops of manners.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman is very much a virgin.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman well-knowing who describes herself to the doctor when she is chaste, or is of the women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find a woman well-knowing this art, especially the operation with hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the incision on the bladder in women is far from the place of the bladder, because you indigeys of pre-incision, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity provokes you to that, then cover that you take a woman midwife well-knowing, and few are found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that, then seek a midwife who is chaste and subtle, or present a woman matron well-versed in the deeds of women, or a woman who in this art has a share of the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore, do that present, and command him to do everything that you tell him, from the inquiry about the stone to the beginning; the reason is that he should see if the woman is a virgin, then when she puts her finger in her anus and wants the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if you find that, force her to put her finger in, and then command him to insert it into her.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the matron to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and inquire about the stone, because she puts her left hand on the bladder, and compresses it with good understanding.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, if you find that, then command her to gradually withdraw that from the orifice of the bladder to the parts below with the sum of her virtue until it reaches the root of the vagina.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then insert it into that position of the majority of the vagina, at the root of the vagina, from whatever part it is stopped and center the stone in that part, and the finger of her should not be removed from the stone, short of her.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section should be few at the beginning; and then insert the ray into that section, and if she feels the stone, then adjust in section according to the quantity which she knows the stone is thrown from that.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the kinds of stone are many: for some are small and large, and lion and sharp, and long and round, and having ramps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many species are of her by what you signify about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust in the place vitriol trissated and put it there for an hour until the blood is absconded, and then return to your operation until the stone is thrown out.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And do that you prepare with you of the instruments which are said in the extraction of stone in men, so that you may be helped by those in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that is incised, then you put powder on the place and tighten that with powders and constriction descends, and do not repeat that; and leave the stone and do not extract it, for very soon the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, when the sharpness of the blood is ceded after some days, and the place can be opened, then you return to your operation until the stone is thrown out.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter lxii.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision upon hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia is nothing but an accumulation of humidity in the white membrane which is below the chain of the genitals containing the bowel, and it is called the membrane.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some times it is in the proper panniculus which has prepared nature in the part of the bowel, before that it is known that it is another bowel; and it is the chain of the genitals between the white membrane which we have said, and it is not that but a tart.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is by weakness which happens to the genitals, for that those are poured into this matter, and sometimes it happens by percussion made upon the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity is having many colors, for the color of it or is declining to citrine or to sanguine, or red, or it is black feculent, or it is aqueous white, and that is what is most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this accumulation of water is: for if it is in the white membrane which we have said, then the abscess is round declining a little to length as if the figure of a bowel, and appear the genitals, for the humidity contains that from every part.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in the proper panniculus, then the abscess is round with a part of the bowel and by this man estimates that it is another bowel.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the chain of the genitals and the white membrane, then cats below the feeling.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And as you want the knowledge of the color of the humidity, then you probe the color of the humidity in the abscess with the entering catheter of which the form is preceded; and according to what is seen in the vestige of the catheter, judge of what is inside of it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of it with iron, then command the patient to be flebotomized if that is possible to you, and times the body of him full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then be resuscitated upon his back upon some cause a little high, and put beneath him many cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then set yourself upon the left part of him, and command the minister to follow on the right of him, the one which extends his arm to one of two sides to the chain of the genitals and to the part of the miracle of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a spatula late and split the chain of the genitals from the middle place by the length until near the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And be made the section according to rectum equally distant from the line that divides the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white membrane comprehending.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And excoriate that, and observe, and guard yourself so that you do not insert that; and your excoriation with which you excoriate by a part just as it should be suspended with the bowel more and subtly scrutinize with the excoriation according to the quantity as much as possible.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then pierce the bladder full of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two labia of the section with hooks, and extend the bladder to the upper parts; and do not touch the cord that encompasses the genitals, and incise the bladder in that manner that is to you possible.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And incise that [bladder] in its entirety or in pieces, and mostly its thin side, for if you do not scrutinize exquisitely the incision of it, it is not made safe that the water does not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the fluid proceeds from that outside of its cord during the time of your operation, then when you will have completed the section of the bladder, return it inside, and then adjust the two labia of the genitals with suture, and then care for it as well as the other ailments, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if the fluid is corrupted by another ailment, then you must cut the vessels that are on the suspensory, and extract the fluid, and then care for it with the water that we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is gathered in two parts simultaneously, then know that there are two hernias; therefore incise that part according to how you have done in the other, and if it seems to you that it is one operation, then you do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you cleanse the blood, and introduce into the sections wool submerged in oil or in rose oil; and place before another wool which you have submerged in wine and oil, and spread that over the genitals and the mirac of the belly; and place above cloths folded and powders, and tie those above with a bandage which is according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	And then take two cloths and be them filled with carmine wool according to this likeness; and be made the extremities with which it is pressed of cloth or of wet wool, and be added with structure in the waistband of the breeches, and one of the extremities presses from the anus into the two, and the second presses at the part of the thigh, and two extremities over two cushions of the thighs and two other extremities over two angles, and all the structure be adjusted in the waistband of the breeches.
