E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it was not necessary iteration in the operation of it and section of it but for the disposition of the frailty of it and for the scarcity of the tolerance of it and fear of it of death, because to it happened in all hours for superfluity of evacuation syncope evil.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And therefore the healing is by whole healing, and nothing is in place of bone hard flesh; and it is made good the disposition of it in its body and returned the virtue of it; and it is converted in its dispositions and did not make to it contrariety in ambulation nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is eminent in the place of the body already drawn, then when you succeed this in this manner: and that you take a ligament and strengthen it at the extremity of that eminent bone, and command to someone that it extends it upwards; and place that ligament of wool thicker than the first ligament; and then tie that over the flesh that is left the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you pull the flesh to the left sides, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you want to sew so that the saw does not damage the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a board or table below the bone decently, because when you do this it is not forbidden the saw that does not succeed the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And cover that it be the sawing over the corrupted place little by little, because if it is in the concavity of the bone corruption and does not appear in its appearance to the touch, and force to sawing of it another time.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not eminent, abates is the one part continued with the other, and the corruption is in the middle place or in a part of it, then you uncover the flesh of all parts totally; and then place a board below, and then saw that of the first part where is the corruption so that it be continued the sawing of the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And be the sawing according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is continued from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if from the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in it reason but engine.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or of the foot, it is very difficult; however, cover that you inquire the corruption in what manner appears to you, and that you open that, and clean that according to whichever disposition which is to you possible, and in case engine be rectified to you, when it does not make to you contrariety vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know which are the incisors and the saws to incise these bones are very according to the situation of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the thickness of those, and the subtlety and the greatness and the smallness of those, and the hardness and their rarity; for that cover when you prepare for all species of operation instrument convenient to that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation signifies to you about the type of instrument of which you indigeysses; when you are great study and long and knowledge of the ways of this art, and witness of ways of illnesses, for then you already have by yourself that which is convenient to them of the instruments to all illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you so to you forming at the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will place as simple with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experiment on others.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of a ray:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this ray be according to the shape of the head of a star-shaped key, and the points of it be according to the shape of the points of the althefegi.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not convenient otherwise than that with that they be confractured the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or the mouth is wide.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a razor larger than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a lat razor:

Shape of another saw decently made: let it be arched as much as possible and the sharpness of it of iron, and the member of it of a boy dagger decently made.

Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor which has a concavity:

Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one resembling a ray, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the ration of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a ray which is convenient to the ration of that which is perforated of the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of acute extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly as to all the causes that we have said of razors and incisors and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision extremities and of the serration of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be caused either intrinsically or extrinsically, or as you will have medicated that corruption by cure of those medicines and the cure does not confer, or sometimes the corruption goes from the member which you do not strike any cause, then as you incise that member into that the honor of the corruption, so that the patient escapes by that of death or malice which is a greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that one to whom it happens, is that the member is made black before it is cured that fire has already burned it, or you may approach the blackness before the poultice of that one is applied to that member which seizes it and which nourishes the whole body; and therefore, you must incise that one.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if the cause of the corruption is the percussion of some venomous causes such as from a sea scorpion or viper or rutabaga and similar.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you incise the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it may enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it happens to the hand, then you incise it at the root of the forearm, and do not give space to the corruption so that it may spread in the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that, then you incise the arm into the armpit at the junction.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes another and sometimes encircles the armpit, then in that is the death of the patient; and administer another cause another to that in cure is the quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do of the foot when corruption envezeys the toe of the foot, then you incise it into one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the heel of the foot, then you incise the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it may enter into the thigh, then you incise the thigh into the junction of the thigh.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the thigh, then in it there is no other than dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of incising the member or of sawing it is that you strengthen the ligament in the part furthest from which you want to incise, and strengthen another ligament over the place; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament above; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments in a lat spatulum until all the flesh is uncovered; and then you incise or saw.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And so that it be placed cloth of linen from all parts so that it does not touch the place itself, and that it comes to the patient lesion adjusted and abscess caut.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if it happens flux of blood when you work, then you cauterize the place carefully, or place upon it some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the afflicted member with a convenient ligament, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I tell you this that happens to a man in his foot, this same accident that I have told you, which is that a blackening occurs in his foot with burning that was assembled like a fire's combustion.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption blackens first in his toe before it spreads throughout the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And therefore that man prepares himself by putting on a poultice that he feels will help the cure to go to the member with the vehemence of it that it throbs with pain and burning, and the blackening of that foot enters into the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time blackens that same corruption in the toe of the hand I indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And therefore it comes to me, and so I am persuaded to reflect that superfluity with what I place on the hand of the medicines, to approach the purification of the body of it; and it does not reflect the superfluity and begins to go to the other toe before it began in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And it implores me to cut the hand of it, and I do not want to do so, hoping for the reflection of that superfluity, and more than I fear the incision of the hand of it dead, because the virtue of the ailment was over the casing.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he left me, he returned to his land and I came to know that that man prepared and cut his hand entirely, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narrative except so that it may be helpful regarding what happens to this ailment, and that its significance by which it is signified and according to which it is treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of wounds and the quality of clysterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members, and the space of the abscess is prolonged while it makes a collection of pus, and then it is broken and perforated, and pus is extracted from it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it is as subtle as cloth, and it has not reached the back corruption, and has not imprinted on the bone or on the nerves or on the ligaments, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But however, if the space is prolonged while the corruption presses into some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that the skin is incised entirely as if it were revolved, and more so when it is subtle and made like cloth, and composes that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin adheres and that the corruption has not reached further consequence, and in the skin there has passed through from the front, then you cure that with clysters.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the brac that you see is of a fetid odor, then you clysterize it with an Egyptian medicine which is of oil and strong wine and ziniar receiving equal parts, and they are placed in a vessel, and they are heated over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and reaches the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and clysterize it with that the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then you extract it with a sponge; and do this for as many days until the sinus is purified and the stench is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some times it is clysterized with ash water, when this medicine is not present to you; and it is that you take the ash of vite, and put water over it; and then you collect that and clysterize it with it until you confess that the sinus is then healed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the ailment has no tolerance over the Egyptian medicine nor the ash water, then clysterize it with water and honey and a little crushed ziniar, and clysterize it with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and more so when in the wine there is superfluity of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this sometimes and you confess that the sinus is already healed, then clysterize it with water that makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of dyphynicon and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine; or that you clysterize it with some medicines and other washes that have the properties which I have already written in the treatise of washes.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow in which the clyster nozzle is not received, then you enlarge it with a small iron little by little, and place in it a poultice enveloped in Egyptian wash or basil wash until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you add the lips of it with suture and leave it in the quantity in which between the clyster there is addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice from which the pus flows is elevated to the upper parts, then dry that in the lowest place that is in it so that the pus flows downwards, because when the pus is constricted in the depth of the sinus the flesh is generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus within the environment of the lowest bone as you want, then you perforate that you prepare the member with the preparation by which the pus flows lightly according to what is fitted to you and that there is no cause of the pus retained in it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take medications that are placed on the appropriate sinus for that which you want to extend those on a cloth of it.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such a quantity as it makes the communication of the whole sinus; and then cut with the shears on the right of the orifice of the sinus a wound a little wider than the orifice of the sinus; and then extend on another cloth of the lions' hides according to the quantity of the wound, and place it on that one in a distant position from the orifice of the sinus so that it be relieved the swelling of the arm of it and do not show the great cloth except after a few days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is on the orifice of the sinus, the which you remove every hour so that it may escape that which is adjusted in it of the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if that which flows from it of the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And thus you consider the place of that sinus, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is in it an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is placed on the orifice of the sinus already adheres, or begins to adhere, then the third day you untie it, and when you untie the bandage, then change the cloth for another and renew the poultice.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus there appears a long space of subtle virus, then do not despair of its adherence, for the healing of it approaches, for some men in whom the slow generation of flesh in their wounds, and of those it is done the contrary of it.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus after many days there is issued arm undigested, then know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and is the prolonged cause, then you adjust in the drying of the medications, and if the medications are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried as a diaphana poultice, when there is in it adjusted superfluity of addition of zegi.

Panaritium is an abscess which arises from the nail of the finger of the hand or of the foot, and it often arises in the other fingers, and when it is prolonged and its cure is less valued, or it is an abscess of an abscess caut, or it is corrupted, and it casts matter while it corrodes the roots of the nail, and often corrupts that whole, and often transmits its corruption to the bone until it is there a foul odor, and is made the extremity of the finger lame, and the color of it is made dark.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incisions of vices, they are varicose.

Vices are varicose, and they are veins convoluted thick full of melancholic superfluities which come in motion of the limbs of the body, and the major advent of them in the legs, and more in the legs of the travelers and the laborers and the porters.

De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the leg.

De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section above the worms generated under the skin and it is called the bovine ailment.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This ailment is called in some lands of us the bovine ailment because it often happens to oxen and it is a worm few one which is born between the bone and the flesh, and it goes in the whole body up and down, and it is shown in the feeling of us its movement from member to member until it disrupts the bone and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of it is by putrefaction of some humors as if it were worms and serpents and earthworms and roundworms in the belly.

And it is feared for the malice of it, because when it goes in the body and is elevated to the head, and it has reached the brain, then very strong fever occurs in it and it enters and destroys the brain, and this happens many times.

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section above the ailment nafir.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This ailment is called in our land nafir, and it is pain which comes in some members, and then it is changed from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that according to what I will tell you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and since it was warm for an hour, I saw that inflammation go as if a worm was pushing towards it, but more lightly than it should be, as if it were living silver when it runs from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then it went into the pain of that place and quivered in the muscle, and I placed my hand there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then I corrected it in the other arm until I reached the other arm.

And I had already seen this before in my pupils in this manner, however, I have seen many of them whose pain was transposed from limb to limb.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this in my pupils as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it to be anything but that because the woman was old, or of dry flesh and exposed veins, and in this appearance, that volatility was transposed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this retro-cure in those who are delicate and with moist flesh and well-covered veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And as you want the cure of it, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not to you apparent in the pupil as we have said, then you strengthen over it and leave it lightly and secse over it until that volatility is constricted, and cauterize the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it in your pupils, then you cure it with the shaking of the body and with that which you expel volatility, and charm them with pills of stench and pills of serapi and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to the species, and according to the places of the body in which they are shot, because their diversity is that of those that have large tips, and small, and concave, and blunt, they are solid; and of those that have three angles, and of those that have tongues; and of those that have shafts.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that one which is according to the limbs and the legs in which it is shot is according to two manners: because the limbs or so principal members concave, as the brain, the heart, the liver, and the lung, and the intestines, and the bladder, and their similar; and therefore when it is shot in any of these members and you see signs of death, which cause you recommend to proceed, then you must avoid the extraction of that arrow in those where death seizes it in the most disposition, and when you do not see these evils signs, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then you extract it and cure the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of the neck is when it is shot in it, and it pierces the bone, and it is emitted from the cyphons which is above the brain, because it happens through it violently soda, and scotomia, and vertigo, and roaring in the limbs, and inflammation and roaring of the tongue, and spasm and mixture of understanding and vomiting of bile, and very strong the word is cut off and the voice is destroyed, and it is emitted from the place of the plague humidity white resembling dust, and eyes of it resembling the consistency of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if these signs appear to you, then you abstain from the cure and the extraction of the arrow, if it is not outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the arrow when it is shot in the heart, are that it is near the left nipple, and feels with that which it has been placed in a hard cause, and it is not a void cause; and very strong the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the pulse, and running of the plague black blood, and seizes that coldness of the extremities, and a sore cold, and syncope; and therefore you know that death descends all the way down.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung are so easily blood sputtered from the plague, and the vessels that are near the neck are inflamed, and the color of the patient is changed, and expiries great spirit a lot, and demands attraction of cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if it is shot in the ligament which is in the feet, and the pain then is near the small bones, and it is made the leg great with vehement pain and with sigh, and it is not bad all the limbs of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if it is shot in the stomach, then very strong eyes of the plague are seen and some undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if it is shot in the belly, and it is put in it, eyes are seen of the plague, or the fabric, or the intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope in the cure of it extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow is shot in the bladder, and it is emitted from outside urine, and it proceeds from it some cause to the parts outside, and very strong is pain on the patient, then you know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But the other members as well as the face, the neck, the throat, and the shoulders and the helpers, and the vertebrae of the back, and the clavicle, and the hip, and the leg and their similar members, are saved according to the greatest dispositions when the arrow does not touch vein nor artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen of the nature of these arrows, so that you may signify this to your healing.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is, that in a man struck by an arrow in the lacrimal bone of his nose, at the root of the nose, and you extracted that from the other side, leaving the gray of the eyebrow, and it is healed, and does not cause any harm in the nose.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew who was struck by it in the gray of his eyebrow, leaving the eyelid, and the arrow was already hidden and could not be obtained from it except for a small extremity with which it adhered to its shaft, and it was a large arrow of the sharp arrows of the Turks, with a lion's head in it, in which there were no eyebrows.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew healed, and did not cause any harm in his eyebrow.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who was struck by it in the throat, and it was an Arabic arrow, and it is the one that has eyebrows; and therefore I incised upon it between two guides, and it was already submerged in his throat; and therefore I subtiliated it with it, and then extracted it, and the Christian healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who was struck by it in his belly, and I thought he would die from it; and therefore, because forty days had passed and there was no change in him from any of his dispositions, I incised upon the arrow and engineered it, and he healed, and did not cause him any harm.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow was lodged in his back, and the plague was consolidated on him, and because it was about seven years, I extracted the arrow from the root of the thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman to whom an arrow was lodged in her belly, and the plague was consolidated within her, and she was not changed in her dispositions in any way, and the woman did not suffer any harm in any of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man to whom an arrow was lodged in his face and the plague was consolidated, and I broke the arrow, not finding much pain here, and many appearances to this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the man of the king's princes who was struck in the middle of his nose and had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to his healing after the lodging of the arrow entered three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And therefore I felt the plague of the arrow very strictly; and then I inquired about it with a subtle attempt, and I did not feel it; but I felt it pricking below the right eyebrow, and therefore I supposed that that prick was because of the extremity of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I plastered the place with a plaster in which there is attractive and digestive virtue, confessing to myself that the place would be apostemated so that it would appear to me the place of the arrow, so that it would succeed on it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And there was no harm in the place significant that the arrow had reached that place; and I continued with the plaster on it for many days and there was no harm; and the plague was consolidated meanwhile, and I broke the patient's evil from the extraction of it for a space of many days until one day he felt the arrow within his nose and recounted this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And therefore I placed upon the plague medicine acute corrosive for many days until it opened, and with the probe I touched it, and felt the extremity of the arrow subtly, which adhered to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjusted in the appearance of the plague by that acute medicine until the extremity of the arrow appeared to me visibly, and it passed to me time with it for the space of time within four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then because the plague had been amplified, and it was possible for me to intervene with the forceps in it, and to remove it, and not to be able to do so by the usual means, then I did not cease to subtly and ingeniously work on it with manners of ingenuity, until one day I began on it with manners of ingeniously hanging it with forceps made descentment, according to how it will come the form of them at the end of the chapter, until I extracted it; and then I restored that plague.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some physicians judged that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, and I restored it, and the plague was consolidated, and the patient healed for entire health, and did not suffer in him in any way.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recount to you the quality of extraction of some arrows so that you may pause this rule and signification upon what I have not said, because the parts of this art and the definitions of it are not comprehended by narration nor are they comprehended by the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artificers compare with few about much; and with what is present about what is absent; and finds novel operation and novel instrument deserves the descent of the extraneous causes of the art when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not forced out of the members in which they are lodged but according to two manners: or by traction of the place in which they enter; or by the contrary of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is drawn out by the place in which it entered, or is an arrow proceeding in fleshy place, and it is drawn and forced out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the easement of the hour in which it catches, then you must leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it becomes soft, and the traction of it and its egress are relieved.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And if it is stuck in the bone and does not obey your pulling, then leave it for a few days and repeat it with traction and movement every day, and it will be out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your pulling, then after a few days, cover the area where the arrow pierced the bone with a fine drill until the area around the arrow is widened, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is stuck in the bone of the head and has already entered one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the patient some of those accidents that I have said, then abstain from the extraction of the arrow and leave it inside until its being is equal after a few days; because if the arrow reaches the brain, then death is not prolonged for him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not stuck but in the bone of the body alone and does not pass into the brain, and the patient remains for a few days, and no accidents happen to him, then you engineer in the traction of the arrow and in the traction of it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is well stuck and does not obey your extraction, then you administer drills in the circuit of the arrow as we have recounted, and then care for the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already lodged in the place of the body, and is hidden from the feeling, then you inquire about it with a probe, and if you feel it, then pull it out with some instruments which are convenient for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot pull it out because of the constriction of the plague and the length of the arrow, and here there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein, then you cut into the plague until it is widened and it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is to the ears that it is held, then you cut away the flesh in which it is stuck on all sides with all the skill that you can do; and engineer about that, if you cannot about the evasion of the flesh in the fracture of the ears and in twisting of those until it obeys.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then you use with the twist of your hand with forceps on all sides until it obeys; and with subtle skill that the arrow is not broken and that it is made to you difficult traction of it and of that extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot about that of your hour, then you leave it for a few days until the parts that are in the circuit of it can be relaxed, and then repeat it when it is relieved.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if to you makes contrariety flux of blood, then you administer that which we have said of cure in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard your virtue of incision of vein or of nerve, or of cord, and administer skill in every manner to you possible of the evasion of the arrow; and do that with facility and tranquility and tardiness and firmness as I and to you recounted.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore that you make contrary the arrow so that the patient be according to the figure according to which fire you must the placement of the arrow in it, because it is more helpful.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not to you possible, then you administer that which is to you possible by the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But if the arrows that are outthrust by the contrary of the other part, or which already from it proceeds any part to the parts outside, or makes difficulty the extraction of the arrow by feeling of the part above the codena proper and sometimes that eminent; therefore you cut about that; and let the section be according to the quantity in which the forceps grasp; and then pull it out, because it is made lighter to extraction.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is held in the bone, then you twist the blade according to contrariety until the arrow presses in the bone, and amplify to itself, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for a few days, and then repeat it until it comes out.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is in it, then you impel it with it.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft is broken and you want to administer impulse, then you introduce and that, if it is blunt, a concave instrument so that between the concavity of it in the tail of the arrow and then impel it with it.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then you impel it with a strong instrument entering into it, because the arrow is relieved by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is envenomed, then cover that you concave all the flesh in which it is the vein, if it is to you possible that, and then care for it with what is convenient.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow catches in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the rib, and it is near so that you touch it with the probe, and it is to you possible to cut about that, then cut about it and guard yourself from incision of vein or of nerve, and extract it, and then close the wound if it is indignant, and cure it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are pulled:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the extremities of them be like the beak of a bird that are made like a saw when they grasp upon the arrow so that they do not let it go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those are made many kinds, great, few, and small, according to the quantity of the greatness of the arrow and its pauqueness, and of the width of the wound, and of the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of impelling concave of this extremity concave as if with the pain of a bird so that it be alleviated the entrance of the arrow in it, and impulse of that deaf:

ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	as if with a ray so that it be alleviated the entrance of it in the concave arrow and is impelled with that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua. E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the semblant of the two veins that are in the lips above.

And the quality of fleubotoming those is that you follow the patient between your hands in front of the sun, and elevate the tongue of him, and look below the tongue, from one side of it vein and from the other side vein, and the color of each one is declining to blackness.
