E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are fleubotomized in the groin are in those that corr custom in all men, and the fleubotomia of them is made according to two manners, or put with the fleubotom mirtilat or olive to subtility declining; or secsar with fleubotom cutellar, and appell it alnessil, and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this alnessil is that convenes to seccio and of those so species latz and subtils according to the amplitude of the veins and according to the stricture of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Method of Flebotomy of the Myrtle:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Make the patient lie as if asleep, and it is necessary to open the concave veins that appear full and large, and those that contain thick, turbid blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the method of Flebotomy of the Olive:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this flebotomy is of lesser width and of more subtle extremity, and it is necessary to perform flebotomy of subtle veins that contain subtle, citrine blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the usefulness of flebotomy of the basilica vein, which is one of three veins: that which extracts the blood from the ailments that are left in the throat and neck, and from which the feet and belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the flebotomist, when performing flebotomy of that vein, to guard well and be over-fearful in that, because below it there is an artery, and if he errs and adjusts in the puncture of the flebotomy, he will cut that artery and there will be a flux of blood, so that he who flebotomizes that with flebotomy pungent, should bring it down as if it were a needle.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica does not appear by manifest appearance, then it is necessary that you leave that and that you change to the other, or that you seek some branch of it; or that you flebotomize in the place of it at the end of the arm, because that one is manifest; and cut that with flebotomy needle as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the flebotomy of the vein, then before the stricture of the arm, touch the place between that you know the place of the wrists, and then place your hand on it with tension; and then lie the arm and cut the vein with concave section with flebotomy needle as we have said; and guard yourself that the percussion for some space of the place of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, as if you were stretching the ligament, inflation in the place that you have marked with tension, then that inflation is inflation of the artery, and therefore avoid that.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the flebotomy as if it were the gold of a child, and the blood is subtle and red, then you know that it is from the blood of the artery; and then you cover and place your hand over that for a long space; and then stop your hand, and if the blood is abscindit, that is, cut off, then you stretch the arm and leave that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And guard the patient from the moisture of him, and be over-fearful of him and do not harm him for some days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not abscindit, and you see that you do not have present medicine for that, then you should cut the artery, if it appears to you; because the extremity of it is contracted, and the blood is abscindit; or that you take a piece of fig, and place that, and take the one majority and stretch that over the place of the vein at the stricture descending am ligament and am pulvils within the other day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is abscindit, it is well; and if not, then cure that with the water of which it is preceded to the remembrance of the place of the pulvils abscinding flux of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the abscission of the blood of it is difficult in many dispositions because of the small place of the plague and the possibility of the ligament of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But of the fusca vein the flebotomy is a usefulness that extracts the blood from the superior part of the head and from the part below the body; for that because it is composed of a branch of the basilica and a branch of the cephalica, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is necessary for the flebotomist that one be over-fearful in the flebotomy of it, because below it there is a nerve; and therefore if he adjusts in the puncture of the flebotomy and touches the nerve, there will come to him stupor, and it is difficult the healing of it, and fort, it is not healed of all; and this nerve many times appears to the feeling; and if it is hidden to some men and it is subtle and not shown, then it is necessary that you pause the flebotomy with the one with which you flebotomize with section of the needle, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you cut the vein in the length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The usefulness of flebotomy of the cephalica vein is that it attracts the blood from the head and comforts the ailments of the heels.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is necessary in this properly, if you want that the flebotomy is done pungen with flebotomy olive or with flebotomy myrtle; because it is the safest of all the veins, because it is not below it the artery nor nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however, it is necessary for you to perform the flebotomy that you guard that with the flebotomy you do not prick the head of the neck so only, and seek the place that is lightest, and do not touch it, if it is not touched with the first percussion that it be over that with flebotomy some times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however, fort, it is an abscess in some men, when it is not flebotomized in the first percussion, but do not touch in re that abscess.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the flebotomy of that and its accidents are many, in which you must think about their rectification.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you should know that flebotomy is not administered unless in the preservation of health and for the hope of it and the precaution of the coming of ailments, and that it should be flebotomy in one of the veins that are in the body, that is: cephalica, fusca and basilica; and that it should be flebotomy at the beginning of spring, after fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter near the meal, when there appear signs of repletion.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And a phlebotomy is performed on the third day or after three hours have passed from the beginning of the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	May phlebotomy be administered, more when it brings convenience and necessity to it, either at night or day, at any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And that a child not be phlebotomized before they have reached fourteen years, and a woman who is pregnant not be phlebotomized until the fourth month until the seventh, and the elderly not be phlebotomized those who have already passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And since whoever wishes to be phlebotomized in any manner, they must cleanse their bowels before the phlebotomy with a lion's clyster, if in those there is much retained feces, so that the veins do not draw the superfluities into the phlebotomy of the bowels, which are purified, and that they do not harm the main limbs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And they should not be phlebotomized those patients who are nauseous, suffering from indigestion, or who are recovering from illness or drunkenness until that is removed from them, nor those who are suffering from dropsy, and more that phlebotomy should be feared near colic, vomiting, and abdominal pain, and near multiplication of coitus and labor and exercise of fasting or vigils, and from every cause that dissolves the virtue, whether corporal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And regarding consideration in the subtle preparation of humors before it, if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if that is possible to it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And regarding bathing if no cause prohibits it, or exercise by any exercise so that the blood is refined.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the phlebotomy from him in the foot of the day, so it is around the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And perforsa that the foot of that one be guarded on that day from all evils accidents animals, as it is anguish, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents, as it is labor and superfluous pain and coitus and semblance to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And to his bed, let them make present the causes in the use of which custom of men with aromatics and scent and with balms and semblance to those according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the phlebotomist upon a cushion that is softer than the cushion of him who is to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And regarding extracting his arm, and rub that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and regarding tightening the ligament with a strap and wrap that two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the constriction be temperate, for the constriction when it is not equal, or the constriction is with superfluity, then prohibit the flow of blood; or it is with softening, and then prohibit the body of blood ascent.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And regarding the constriction, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together meanwhile until the veins are inflated, and declared to the feeling.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And regarding the phlebotomist, anoint his phlebotomy with a little of olive oil properly; and regarding placing his left hand's index finger upon that vein, below the place of which he wishes the phlebotomy, so that the vein flee a little, and the percussion be seated, for of the veins is the one that atrophies as the cords flee, and of those is that which is full of venosity and when he pauses the phlebotomy upon that one it is contracted, and it is uncovered the phlebotomist; and the phlebotomy does not open the vein, and if it opens, that one is straitened.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, for this, let the phlebotomist be halted and be solicited in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And regarding pausing the phlebotomy, but if the vein is opened in one time, then well is it; and otherwise, you iterate that another time below that place a little, or upon it with a festinacio, if the place is not apostate.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the place is apostate, or the patient is frightened, then you leave it for a day or two, and do not tighten the ligament, for strong it will draw the apostate caut, nor enter into a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And regarding iterating the phlebotomy if the blood is good.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the aperture is small and the blood flows subtly, and you fear that it will not be the quantity of blood that you wish, then you iterate the phlebotomy in that tract according to rectitude and adjust in the aperture a little, and do that with a festinacio before the place is apostate, for the place is apostate in many men of little aperture.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if sometimes that is already apostate, then you do not iterate upon it, for it excuses you no cause; and pause upon that any part of the wound of oil, for it alleviates the body of the blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place than oil and than the other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly administer a wound of oil in all phlebotomy with which phlebotomies the veins of which the prohibition of the course of blood, and do that tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when it is placed upon the place, for the blood is refined and is revolved when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the place of the phlebotomy is generated a great apostate, for many times it happens, and most to him who has not been bled but that one time, or in the aperture of the vein little, and then you cover, and place upon the place a sponge infused in water and salt, a little scalded, and tighten that for an hour, for it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And now he must make this incision near the vein's opening with a compliment to it or another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if it remains in the area for some days, some blackness or greenness, do not notice it; and if you want, place on that some cause of aloes and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of mint juice or calamint or something similar.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times abscesses and swellings require phlebotomy of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And then place your hand over it, and if it is soft, you must place your compression over it, then that prominence is bad and evil; and therefore, be careful that you place on it any cause of what they have said, because it will flow strongly from the artery of blood.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a plaster with that which is astringent, so that the place may endure, and then cure it with the other cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And now he must extract blood from every man according to the quantity of his virtue and according to the color which appears on the blood.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, then you let it flow until it is rough; and similarly if you see it thick, then you let it flow until it is subtle; and similarly if it is acute, until the sharpness of it is gone.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And now he must for one who is full and strong and has need of blood extraction in one time, that the phlebotomy of the vein be amplified and the phlebotomy be wide.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for one who is frail, the opposite of that must be done, and now he must extract it in small portions, and that the cut be narrow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of the vein is that it be the transverse section, not the puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from the flow of blood and from the incision of nerves, and is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy according to width and length.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which it is customary to occur syncope before phlebotomy, and now he must cure that before phlebotomy with a little bread soaked in wine of millegrains or simple oxymel scalded; and extract from the one blood in three or four times.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is a cold constitution, then before phlebotomy, prepare a soak in a syrup of myrrh or in a syrup of honey flavored with spices like pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar, or in a syrup flavored and fragrantly smelling.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if syncope occurs during phlebotomy, and the cause of it is the emission of too much blood, then he must prepare to drink water of meat and fragrant syrup; and use aromatics with algualea, and be the one to rub their feet with it.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use of the other causes that have been said in the division in the chapter of syncope by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And he who wants to have his arm opened and dissolve his blood according to the second time, must to him whose phlebotomy is by much evacuation, and the virtue of him is frail, that he evacuate the blood little by little, so it is according to the quantity of the virtue in the continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But he who wants to have his arm opened, and take his blood a second time, and his body is strong, then do this about seven or nine hours from the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But he who wants to draw the blood from his body contrary to the part to which it declines, must be opened on the second day or the third.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But that body in which there is much blood already scalded and is acute and causes fever, must have blood drawn from it in one time and a large quantity be drawn, and the incision be amplified until syncope occurs, because you will have preserved all the conditions of phlebotomy; and that you place your hand over the wrist of him from the blood, so that it does not become death in place of syncope, because many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not, when you want to open the arm and evacuate the blood a second time, as already the orifice of the vein is closed and it is made difficult the emission of blood, that you press over it with vehemence and curve it slightly, because this is too bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Have the vein let go until it is phlebotomized properly; or remove this with the sharpness of the phlebotomy which is coagulated blood in the orifice of the vein; or place on it of tyriaca alfarach, or of sagzenea, and compress this with light compression until the blood is gone.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave that and do not touch it until the abscess is settled.

E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament. E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And make the incision wide and make your phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize that one on the joint of the hand a little.

E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all the others, because it has no pulsating vein, nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the saphenous vein of the right hand is convenient for the ailments of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re. E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And conserve that you do not finish your hand with the phlebotomy, because from there the nerves of the fingers are denuded of flesh.

E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias. E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And be the phlebotomy skillful.

E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs in the first attempt, then iterate with the phlebotomy in a little more, because the place is safe; and do not fear of that malice, but that you guard yourself from the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do of the saphenous vein of the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic vein, the place as we have said is below the heel of the left side.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of the phlebotomy of this is to pain of the hip when it is by blood caut.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of this is that the patient enters in bath, and fastens and strengthens the thigh of him from the side of the wide up to the talon of the four fingers in a long and subtle bandage, so that it appears not by that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to each engine that is to you possible and according to the traverse, and it is better; or incise that by incision or secces that by section, because the place of it is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And she is in many men well-liked; and if you touch that, and it does not appear to the feeling of all, then phlebotomize some ram of it, and it is that which appears in the back of the foot in front of the auricular and the annular.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And guard yourself from the nerves, and make run of the blood the quantity that you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then untie the constriction and place on the place of the phlebotomy cotton and strengthens the place, because lightly it is healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of cupping and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping is of horns, or of earthenware, or of copper.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And cupping is done according to two manners: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is cupping without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this cupping that is without scarification is according to two manners, because it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the cuppings that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood there are fourteen places of the body, of which one in which cupping is placed is alnocrati, and it is the rear part of the head; and the middle place of the two parts of the neck together; and cupping of the chin below the jaw more below the mouth; and cupping of two spatulas; and cupping of alohoster, and it is on the end of the shoulder; and cupping of two focils, and it is of two arms; and cupping of two groins; and cupping of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventosation does not extract the blood but from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and therefore it does not catch the virtue through those, just as it is caught by phlebotomy; nor is it right that ventosation be done with fire or with fire in any illness caused by repletion until the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes ventosation for illness or for continuous, administer it at every hour at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and in any time it is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that of those men in whom the blood is multiplied within that which is indigenous to its extraction by ventosation and finds in their head heaviness and soda; and of those it is that finds repletion and redness in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and of those it is that finds pricking in their face and in their forehead and darkness and dullness in their eyes; and of those who vomit the place of their ventosation; and of those it is that their laughter is multiplied; and of those it is that finds taste of blood in their mouth, or that the tongue is coated and spits blood; and of those it is that their sleep is multiplied, and of those who dream blood in their sleep redness and nightmares and other causes to their appearances.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when times in any cause of those, and properly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command ventosation to be done because it has passed from the day of two or three hours.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventosation of the neck is that when that confers the gravity to the head and to what is poured into the eyes; but it is right that this is after the evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventosation is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not light that use of it that one who is of frequent congestion, or in which is catarrh, because it gives to that great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore it is not right that use of that the old, and in the heads of whom are frequent illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to that one who over that is continuing over it is done oblivion; and therefore it is right that you command the ventosator that pause his hand a little with the ventosa to the parts below, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventosation of the ankle is in the place of phlebotomy of the vena fusca and basilica: and therefore confers on asthma, and on the constriction of the lung and on the fissure of the instrument of the lung, and on cough, and on repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is right that the ventosation of the ankle be expelled a little, because if it is paused below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And ventosation of the alhagdahan confers on the pains accidental in the head and on ophthalmia, and migraine, and pre-focus, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is right that you command the ventosator that he not press his hand with scarification so that it does not pierce the artery and occur fluxes of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And ventosation below the chin confers on alcohol in the mouth, and on corruption of the gums, and appearances to those of the illnesses that are in the mouth, and stand in the place of phlebotomy of aliheric that is in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the ventosation that is done on the two spatulas confers on caphatan, which is made by repletion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventosation of the two parts of the teeth of the focils confers benefit of phlebotomy of three veins, so it is of the basilica, fusca and cephalica, because that one attracts the blood of all those veins more numerous that are in the flesh, and those veins smaller of the other veins more thick until it reaches the attraction to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the ventosator that too much he does not proceed in scarification, because the place is denuded of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a ventosation with which is ventosated over those and confers on the hemorrhoids of the anus and on the ulcers more below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is right that you command the ventosator that it be a large ventosation, and that it be of eram, because the place indigenous to strong section; and strong leu so ventosations subtiles and be scarified with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But ventosations of the limbs less by minutio manifest, because they attract the blood of the whole body, and confer on old pains of the ribs and of the mother, and of the bladder; and they provoke the menses, and confer on bothor and ademil; and they stand in the place of phlebotomy of two sophenas, and alahorcoben, and of two cavilhas.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, too much debilitates the whole body and causes syncope in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the ventosations alahorcoben the benefit is proper to the benefit to the ventosations of two limbs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the ventosations is that you pause the ventosa at the beginning void and sucks by temperate suction, and do not prolong the position of the ventosations, but pause those lightly, and remain those carefully, and that the humors come to the place by advent equal.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this and continue until you see the area already reddened and inflamed and that the flow of blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and repeat the suction little by little, and then consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who has tender flesh, because you scarify him once and no more, so that the area is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the ventouse to amplify the scarification and press a little, and temper the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if in the blood is thickness, then you must scarify twice, because in the first scarification the way of subtility to the blood and its fluidity is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second to the scrutiny acquired of the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very feculent, then make the third scarification so that you can achieve the last.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little, it suffices us one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want the extraction of much blood, we scarify with much scarification; and if we knew that the blood is thick, then we must scarify by pre-scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which is the depth of the incision only so much.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that one whose incision is thick, hard, dark, and whose pores are narrow, then the places of the ventouses should be anointed more gently, more open, more resolved; if it is in summer, as it is olive of aloes or olive of violet, or olive of double almonds, or olive of quince; and if it is in winter, then olive of narcissus, or olive of lily, or olive of chamomile, or of saint, and to those similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, hot, then the oil should be of amaranth, or of balm, or of aloes, or of anise, and to their likeness.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the ventouse has wide pores of tender flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and that those in the places of the ventouses near them, the suction should be washed with waters or with cold water of salwort, or with quince water, or with water of  borage, and similar to those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that one whose blood is of much humidity, washes their ventouses with vinegar, or with myrtle and sumac water and similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of that one whose superfluities are thick, washes their ventouses with old vinegar, or with water of  sarsaparilla, which is marjoram, or of decoction of anise, or of chamomile, and to their likeness.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And that the suction should be guarded before bathing; bathe it should be administered near the bath for an hour or for two, and that he should sleep near the suction.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is what must be done to regulate the ventouse before phlebotomy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	At the beginning, you should consider: then if the ventouse or the one who is to be phlebotomized is choleric and windy, and has blood that is sharp and inflammation, then you should prescribe cooling causes, such as vinegar-soaked millet, endive with vinegar, lettuce, and  secale, and syrup, and to their likeness.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their foods as much as possible, and birds' meat, and foods seasoned with vinegar, and to their likeness.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that one whose complexion is cold, you should prescribe to drink syrup of althea, or syrup of  secale of seeds, and sumac, and strong-smelling vinegar between old and new; and that he should be commanded to use little drinking and eating, and pause the foods of his little, and canary, and sparrows, and small birds, and pigeons.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And that on the day of suction and phlebotomy, the drink should be greater than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And that some men should be given to drink, in some hours, tyriaca alpharac, or medicines of musk, that is, nutmeg, or alcelita before the suction or phlebotomy or near it, so that the main limbs be comforted and that the blood be subtiliated; and they should not take that scalfatz.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the ventouses that are scarification should be those that are placed on the liver, and on the spleen, and podagra, and on the navel, in the places of the joints, and the tip of the big toe, because these members do not suffer scarification upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those, but rather attraction of blood from the limb, such as placing a ventouse on the nipple in the illness of blood flow from the blood of the nose; and use of that so that it be dissolved cold and viscous air of the limb, such as placing on the belly and navel; because that rarefies the limb and scalfs it and removes the pain because it resolves the air.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already placed on the boils when they happen in their opening or pimple, because by virtue of the strong attraction, the boil is opened and eradicates the pimple from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is placed on the liver and spleen of those who have wind enclosed in those.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these fumigations are administered empty with suction only; and some times are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some times are administered full of boiling water in the ailments of the liver.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the fumigation should be filled and larger, it is boiling water alone or water in which herbs are boiled according to the convenience.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Method of fumigation administered with fire: its width of the orifice is two fingers, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the preon is the majority of a palm; and it is in the place of it, in the place that is in the circuit, the majority of it, the tract is small according to the quantity that enters it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is made of a ram's horn or a citrus, of thick edges, lion, equal and smooth so that it does not damage the limb of its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it a transverse bar of ram's horn or iron, on which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this fumigation is larger than the one we have described; and the few less than that according to the ailments and the state of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the fumigations of the infants and exhausted are others than the fumigations of the young and of robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this fumigation with fire on the limb is that it extends the fire with firewood decently in front of a small candle of wax, and places it on the middle of the transverse bar in the middle place of the fumigation, so that the fire is ignited around the part below so that it does not burn the body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed on the limb of the patient, and the finger is on the tract that we have said, and as soon as we have the fumigations and do not indicate that we show the finger and that the vapor escapes on that tract, then the fumigation is immediately dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then prop the fire according to its manner, and repeat that if it is indicated.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in fumigation that is administered in the ailment of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse bar nor tract, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the limb only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this fumigation as much as it is larger, so much is better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered in all members but in the members in which it is not possible to position fumigations, because of the smallness of those, such as the mouth and gums and similar to them; or in a member denuded of flesh, such as the finger and the nose and their similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found leeches that are in the waters of double purification.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are laid in the day and the night in double water until they are famished, and that no cause remains in the belly of those; and then they are evacuated the body at the beginning with phlebotomy and with fumigations; and then they are rubbed the limb of the patient until it reddens; and then they are placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And as they are filled and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suction the place with fumigation, it is more beneficial in healing.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with wine vinegar and then with a lot of water; and it is rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the bleeding of the patient is prolonged after the application of the leeches, and this is the result, then you put a cloth of it in cold water, and place it on top until the bleeding stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is multiplied, then pulverize over it triacetic vitriol, or gallnuts and similar to them of the stiptic causes, until the bleeding is stopped; or are placed on the place the halves of boiled beans, and are laid until the beans adhere to the place, and the bleeding is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And then, if necessary, repetition of leeches, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then the place is rubbed with fresh blood or a needle is left in the places until blood comes out; and then they are placed, because those when they feel some blood immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, pulverize over them a little bit of triacetic aloes, or salt, or ash, and they detach immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the prolegomena of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the restoration of fracture and dislocation accidents in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	O, son, know that these foolish physicians and the vulgar boast of this chapter and those who never at any time regarded the books of the Ancients nor read from them a single letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is made that this manner of the learned in our land is deprived; and you do not forget this at any time well of all; and I have not adopted this that I have learned, but by length of reading the books of the Ancients and study over the understanding of those, until I extracted the science of those.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And henceforth, direct yourself to experiment and study throughout the length of your life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And now I have described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which the best experiment has been passed; because I have shortened this for you others and freed it from the occupation of elongation; and I have shortened it at the end of shortening; and I have shown it at the end of declaration; and I have formed in this many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as it has been done by addition of declaration, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summaries and collections from the fractures of bones, from those whose preliminary explanation is necessary, before we begin the recollection of broken and diverse members of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, I say in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of which at the beginning the artificers are forced and stand on the truth of those; so it is for you and those who are prompt to know or learn this noble art others than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when accidents happen to any fracture or dislocation or sprain or wound, then you must at the beginning apply yourself to phlebotomy or to leaven that, or one or the other, if no cause prohibits it, as much as the weakness of virtue, or the one to whom the accident happens is a child, or old in decrepitude, or the time is of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content in his food of cold herbs and of bird meats and of crabs; and forbid thick meats and to fill him with foods and of all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are sure of the cauterization of the abscess, and if you do not fear the effusion of matter to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen to which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore, as the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient must be fed with nutritious foods of nourishment moist and thick in which is viscosity, as such as foods made of cooked wheat with water, and rice, and heads, and fish, and bellies of cows, and eggs, and fresh poultry, and thick fat and similar to those, and with this regimen is made coagulation of the fracture more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the broken bones when they are in the men who are in the first youth and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they are continued and consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all times by the drying of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated those that are of them at the end of the youth, as the bones of the little children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But however, nature adjusts and amnesties over the broken bone from every part any cause seeming to glut in which is thickness that adheres and strengthens it until it is at the same time conglutinated and tied together, until they come to the end of fortitude and of firmness, as fire at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this cause it is necessary that you pause the foods of the patient, foods in which there is gravity and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many diverse varieties of fracture according to the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, because a fracture of the bone of the leg is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the hand; and similarly all the other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come to the recollection of all species of fracture, explained in their distinct chapter from the other.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many diverse varieties of fracture in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And they are diversified the species of fracture of the bone in their own; because it is made arched fracture another that happens in it stars; and some times it is made fracture according to the length of the bone: and in the fractures of the sagittal and asterisks and additions proceeding and non-proceeding, as it is done in the pen when it is prepared to write, and it is fracture with plaque and disruption in the head, and it is small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to every species is engendered or torment proper in the restoration of it according to that which will come recollection of it distinct in its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this it is known fracture of the bone: it is the tortuosity of it, and of that eminence and appearance of it to the touch, and so of it when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is not in the place apparent tortuosity nor so is not made by your touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is not here fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However it is possible that there is tortuosity or small fissure, therefore you must not touch it with your hand and with compression of all; however pause upon it of the medicines of which comes recollection near that moment which convenes to the place; and then be straight by subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place when it is arched and is not split in two or another that does not happen in it sagittal, as it is remaugged all part of its comparison, then you must begin from your hour to rectification of it, however it must happen to it abscess cauterization.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if a boil occurs to him, then leave it for some days until the boil subsides; and then treat it in whatever way you can with elevation and hygiene.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration of him and the piercing of him is lighter than of the bone in which the accident happened.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen him according to what will come the remembrance of him.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is broken, then it is necessary to extend this broken limb from two parts, if it is the arm or the leg; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be in the position with which you pause the limb located according to its natural figure, while the parts are extended from the broken limb, then you pierce that you make them return with hygiene and in whatever way you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself according to your strength that it does not happen to the patient by your operation pain or injury; and pierce yourself according to your power that you apply one bone with its companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And cover that in that hour profitably you touch with your hand that, and if you see here any different cause, rectify that and treat it for the amount of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as such foolish doctors do who, in their many practices, cause boils to occur by their operation, or cause contraction in the limb as we have seen by the operation of their many practices.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then annex, then equation and decent operation and constriction of that limb, and rest and tranquility; admonish the patient about this and make him swear that he will not harm it in the hour of his vigils and of his sleep, and watch his revolution and agitation, and guide his digestion, and guide all his movements with all his virtue; and wait until the position of the limb is in the position which is assured of the pain, which cause is when he feels in the disposition of the position of the limb pain or injury; then cover that you change it to another disposition of that with which he does not feel pain; and guard with this that the position of him that be straight and equal, so that the limb does not happen tortuosity when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the tranquil limb is that which I recommend; for that you know that broken limbs are diversified in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small as the arm and the hand and the foot and similar to those, then cover that the envelope be of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are gross as the thigh or the leg, then cover that in those be envelope thick and hard, for the thick bandage connects the great limb and strengthens it with equal constriction, so that in it no macula enters.
