E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, then your evacuation of equation, pause a convenient ligament to this, on the place of that fracture with three or four envelopes according to that the limb merits; and strengthen your hand a little with the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see in that to the part more sovereign of the place of the fracture, and strengthen less than not focus your constriction with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then elongate yourself with the envelope of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the constriction little by little, until you take from the place a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and envelope that other practice over the broken place with the envelope, and then see in the envelopes to the part further from the fracture; and be your operation in the constriction of the envelope and in the softening of that according to what we have said in the first envelope below.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the envelopes of wool or cloth with which be equalized the tortuosity of the fracture, if in it is tortuosity; and if not, do not pause in it any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause over it another bandage, and then treat over these envelopes stars decently made as soon as, if in the place there is no inflammation or boil, and then pause over it that which sits the boil that and that oste the inflammation; and leave it for some days; and then you strengthen over it the stars.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And be the stars of the majority of thick cane, and well formed wisely; or be of pine wood; or of palm ramps; and be the width of each star according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, cover that the star that is placed over that fracture be thicker and thicker a little than the others stars, and the length of the star according to that is measured to the limb in magnitude and smallness; and then strengthen over the stars with another bandage according to your first constriction; and then lie below it with a faithful decent according to that we have said of constriction, and it is that your constriction be according to the place of the fracture more, and as much as it is lengthened from the fracture, it is less the constriction.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And cover that the threads be middling in thickness and subtlety, and be of wool; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen by the operation of some foolish people placing their threads of cords of wool, and it is a great error, when cats the constriction outside equality.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And excessively subtle threads are not convenient, for you will not consecrate by constriction with those that which you want, and cover that between star and star there be less than a finger.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is said to be suffering from the extremities of the stars near the stricture in their place, then place those of wool or felt between them so that it does not cause injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is accompanied by a plague, and an accident occurs in the bone, and you will find a remedy for this in the second chapter on singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that if a whole limb is broken, it is not straight with stars on the first day; the cause is that the limb, when it is large, should not be laid upon stars but rather about five days or seven or more, according to your certainty of the advent of a boil.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasters with which the ancients restored, those which are placed upon fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Manner of plastering common to the restoration of fractures, convenient to many complexities and mostly to women and children, because it is of this which does not bring heat nor cold: and it is that you take from the powder of flour, and it is the medulla of the flour that you must take from the movement of the mill on the sides of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And mix it thus, unless you sift it with album of egg, and place the confection of it not thick nor subtle; and then use of that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to plaster a fracture, dislocation, and sprain: take asafoetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and migrach, which is the root of wild millet, of all ana drachma x; of frankincense and aloe ana drachma v; alochil ana drachma xx; all be ground and sifted and be mixed with alichil water or album of egg if the patient's complexion is pale; and then use this plaster, because it is of good composition and restores the bones broken lightly, and confers to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way of plaster which confers to a fracture and sprain: take migrach and powder of white althea ana drachma x; of frankincense and aloe ana drachma v; of acacia drachma vi; of Armenian bole drachma .xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All shall be triturated in a mortar with much contricio, and sifted, and comfitzed with water or album of egg and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Manner of plaster to joints and bones separated from their places, and if pain occurs in those and in fissures and fractures: take wool suet and submerge it in vinegar and boiled oil and place it upon the place.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	More in this plaster there is not virtue of restoration, of boil caut and expels pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another manner of plaster that restores broken bones: take fig leaves and leaves of wild poppy; contrive all and make a plaster of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Manner of plaster abbreviated administered  deves the restoration of fracture of bones and when you want resolution of the remaining boil: recipe roots of altea, of chamomile and flowers of violets, of ers flour, of all ana part .i.; All shall be triturated and comfitzed with wine, if the limb is not scaled.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scaled, then mix it with humid coriander water or with water and use of it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another manner of plaster more strong in resolution than this first, when accidents occur hard boil, deves the restoration of the limb: recipe of roots of altea and of seed of li, and of balaustia, and melilot, majorana, flowers of violet, of chamomile, of all ana part i engual; all shall be triturated and comfitzed with water of sauze or with sweet water or with wine, all that according to the quality of the limb and the repose of the color of it.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Ypocras does not say in his book that it should be placed upon the broken limb for the restoration of it unless cerot made of wax and oil and no other cause; and recommends that it be midway between thickness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But Gualia has been seen that they should be placed upon the broken limb for the restoration of it and the causes in which is exsiccacio with little of heat so as such as myrrh, incense and similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Manner of plaster that confers to lesion and pain: recipe migat, of cezes, of human hair unshorn or feather of bird, and of altea, and salt, parts equal; all shall be triturated and sifted and comfitzed, and be made plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the quantity according to which it should remain the liadura and then be untied, is that you consider if it does not occur pain nor pruziment nor the bone is broken no is bad of its place, then you do not untie for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there occurs to the place vehement pain or pruziment or imflacio, then you yourself take or untie that in the hour, and remove the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take cloth from him and a sea sponge, moistened, and submerge it in tepid water, and with that wash the place until the swelling ceases and the pain is subdued; and then let him rest the limb for an hour; and then place on it a woolen cloth submerged in vinegar and oil or rose oil, and lay it on him for a night until you are sure of a cauterized abscess, and that the swelling of the limb is calmed, and the pain of it is subdued.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that stricture subtly and a small plaster and do not tighten it with your first constriction, and more subtly with that until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and the redness and the pain and the swelling and all the accidents are already subdued, and you want to remove the plaster and the stricture, then you apply it again as you have done at the beginning, equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no accidents happen to the limb of those that have been said, then do not untie it, but for three days or four or five or seven. And sometimes all this is left for twenty days, according to how it appears to you from the untieing of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it approaches the coagulation of the flesh upon it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the stricture more than in your first stricture, altogether, and adjust in the thickness of the patient's food, according to how the recollection of him precedes.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the place of the fracture already dry and extend more than the bone, then you know that the nourishment is prohibited to reach there; and therefore embroca that with tepid water you must always that you heal it; and that in all three days; and alleviate the stricture a little, and for this operation, the nourishment runs to the limb, and it is healed slightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But that which fools restorers of the fracture of the limb do another way when it is not restored at the beginning, according to the bone, and it is restored according to tortuosity, is error according to the operation of theirs, and great fear, and if it were straighter, that which enlarges the Ancients in their books and they have done with that.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, because it is more reasonable that they do not do that.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Second: Of fracture when it happens in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and their causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by the blow of a weapon, and the blow breaks all the bones within the skull, which is left the bone, as if it were done in the shaft, and for this reason this species is called ascial; or the weapon incides some part of the bone, and incides the flesh of it and does not pass the incision into the rear of it; and this species of fracture is called absolute levitation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures or is great or small, and of fracture that is contortion or attrition; and the cause of it is percussion with a hammer or a fall on a rock, and their likenesses.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture or is penetrating that already approaches the panniculus which is left the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures or is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture is that which is entwined in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair, and for this reason this species is called capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And is fracture that is made either by a fall or by percussion of a rock and its likenesses, which causes some lamina of the bone to enter into the parts within, and it is made in the concave place as if it happened to the payroles of a ram when it happens to their percussion and it is part of their entrance into the parts within.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And most of all this is done in the bodies of wet bones, as if they were the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And to all these species of fractures, satagias, they are heavy as if stars separated.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you will come with recollection of all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we shall know all these species of fracture by detection upon those and by inquiry of them with tents and ostentation of corrupted flesh that is upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary species is known because it is discovered upon the bone, and it is abstergit, and lined upon it with a tent, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the cure of fracture, consider at the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see by the accidents that signify by manifest signification upon pain, as it is vomiting of bile, and extension, and loss of understanding, and abscess of voice, and syncope, and acute fever, and swelling of the joints and redness of those, and likenesses to them in the greatest dispositions, then adopt that it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see non-current accidents, you hope for health, then you begin the cure of him.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is that if it has come to you the afflicted in the beginning as it is afflicted and this is in the days of winter, then you must study in the ostentation of the bone before the fourteenth day according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then you must study to see the bone before the seventh day, because that which is left the bone be corrupted from the panniculus, and that the accidents that we have recounted may happen.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the membrane covering the brain, and it is in small pieces and shredded, then cover the small and rubbed piece, as I will tell you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you raise the patient's head, and uncover the bone according to custom and manner as much as possible according to the figure of the plague, and that it be light on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you to see the bone, blood or pus flows, then you oppose it with what you cover, and that you fill the place with cloths infused in wine and rubbed oil, and make the patient rest until the pus is settled, and if you are sure of the blood flow; and then begin in the circuit of the bone and in its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two ways of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one way is that you cut the bone with a straight incisor like this, and this is the shape of it: And then administer another incisor this one, a little wider than that; and this is the shape of it:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer the wider incisor than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And cover that you have to have a number of different incisors, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are at the end of the sharpness of their extremities, and are of Indian iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion on the incisor so that it does not hit the head and damage it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then cover that you perforate in its circuit before you administer the incisors with the drills, which are called non-deep drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus but because those do not pause the term of the bone of the test to what is about it, for as the drill is a round extremity or margin on which the head of it is left sharp like a margin or a small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take of these drills a large number of which as many as convenient to the thickness of each bone,  and that it be to you present in all tests of the brain the extremity of which be sharp, the quantity in length and brevity be according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of drills: The quality of perforating in the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the drill on the bone and revolve it with your fingers until you know that the bone is already penetrated; and then change the drill to another location, and pause it that is between all the tracks the quantity of the thickness of the ray or about that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then cut with incisors that which is between each tract of the bone, and make that as subtle as you can on it in the end of lightness, as we have said, until you eradicate the bone, or with your hand, or with some other cause for some instruments which you will have prepared for it, as such as tongs and subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And cover that you guard with all caution that the incisor does not touch any cause of the scalp.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And therefore as you will have circuited the bone, and if it is continued with it, and you will have that extracted, cover that you raise and smooth that in the roughness of it of that which is in the bone with another instrument similar to an incisor, but however cover that it be more thin and more subtle than the others incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any pieces of the small bones and splinters remain, then take that with ease with that which you owe you of the instruments; and then take care of the patient with liniments and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other way of operation is lighter, farther from pain, which says Gualia and the lauzec by great lausor; and this is the sermon of it: it is necessary to you at the beginning that you begin to discover the part of the bone of the place in which is the fracture most vehement and most manifest, until when you will have discovered that part and you will have placed below it the extremity of this incisor lent and light of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that the lenticular part is long and do not cut any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides forward in length, as sometimes; that the lenticular part be adjusted to the scalp with the face of it incident acute in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike on the incisor of a part with a small mallet until you cut all the bone with ease as it is revolved, and you be sure of the membrane that no accident happens in it in any manner, and if the medicant14 was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And now if any cause annexed to the bone of the membrane in some places of bone, cut that of it with the extremity of that lenticular incisor, and deliver that of it with ease, for it is delivered of it its harm and its pain.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the membrane, and that which is abscised or is stayed from the bone is the face of it, and remains in it roughness and subtle splinters, then cover that you raise that roughness and eradicate those splinters with subtle razors of which you have prepared the number, of various quantities so that it be to you possible to administer of those in every place the most convenient of them and the most right of them according to what in which you are losing your operation of that broken bone and its figure.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And as you administer in your reason with which roots the bones at the beginning the pus of those roots, and then use the most subtle of it, and do not cease to do so continuously until you reach to administer the pus thick and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	In any of the other fractures, small and subtle, as you administer care according to what you perceive for the rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is because it is not known about all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this is what we have shown written about great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the periosteum is cut when you set the bones, then take cloth according to the quantity of the wound, and submerge it in hot oil, and place it over the orifice of the wound; and then take another cloth folded or tripled and submerge it in wine and hot oil and place it over the first cloth and do this as lightly as you can so that you do not injure the scalp; and then administer over this bandage, and do not tighten it except for the quantity that the wound alone has.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave this with this care for a day or two until you are sure of the abscess cauter; and then untie this and then administer medicines with which is superfluous dryness, such as root of linen and flour of herbs, and powder of incense and of aromatics, and similar to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines powder that is pulverized over the wound, such as they are dried; and universally, administer in this all medicine of property of which it is that it cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And guard yourself according to your virtue that the wound in your cure be clean; and not be in it dirt of rinsing nor other; nor let virulence be added to it; for when it is adjusted over the periosteum of the brain, it corrupts that and you can spoil it, and it happens to the patient according to that evil malice.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the scalp of the head, as from it is modified the bone and most when the cure of it is less considered, and it is blackness on the surface of it; and therefore consider then if it happens to the patient the accidents that we have said, know that it is pernicious if all is adopted.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it does not happen blackness but from the medicine that is placed over it, and it is in virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then take of honey one part and of hot oil three parts. And in those liniments a cloth, and then place that over the scalp; and then cure this with the species of cure that convenes until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that it is not broken of the nose but two parts together, or one of those sometimes, for in it you have two bones, for the part left is cartilaginous, and it is not broken and it does not happen to it but attrition and tortuosity and sinuosity.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts is broken, then take the said little one in the one's nose, and that you equalize that fracture from within with your said finger, and with the said point outside, until the nose returns according to its natural figure.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And be done this by you with facility, and guard yourself that no pain be caused to the patient by that your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the most sovereign part of the nose, and the said one does not reach to that, then let it be equal to the extremity of the ray in which it is small thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the semblance of that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And guard yourself with the restoration of it in the first day of the fracture, if it is possible; and if not, then the VII or X days of the abscess cauter.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then introduce into the extremity of the nose a wick of cloth from it, if the fracture is in one part, or put two pads, if the fracture is in two parts, and be in the pad thickness of as much quantity that it fills the groove of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And say some of the ancient restorers that the pads be encased in border, and be changed every day, but it has not been seen to me; have that the wick be encased in album of honey with powder of moli; and then leave the one until the bone be set and the cartilage be hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes be introduced into the nose, in place of a pad, a pain of auca pus that is enveloped in cloth of lion; and be that already you have the fracture of the nose most vehement and that the patient be not prohibited from inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary to you; and if you want, do this, and if you want, do pads.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if it happens another time abscess cauter, plaster the nose with cerot or with coto infused in wine and hot oil, or with diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if it does not happen abscess cauter, then take to plaster that outside with flour of sesame and with powder of incense cofitz with album of honey; and then place on it lion's wool, and do not lie the nose with any cause.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with small fracture or are comminuted, then take to split over those, and extract those with instruments that are convenient for those; and then close the fissure, and cure that with what encases and consolidates, and with plasters to that convenient.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if plague occurs inside the nose, then treat that with warm water and administer lead pipes while it is entirely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter IV.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture of it is not inflamed, then observe if the fracture is deformed only slightly, and not broken in two and curved at the parts inside, then its recognition is lighter.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then you introduce your left index finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly if the fracture is on the left mandible, then introduce the right index finger; and push with that the looseness of the fracture inside with ease to the parts outside, with your other hand from the outside of the bone; and thus decently equal that.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the jaw fracture is already separated into two parts, then you must administer extension of two parts according to rectitude as much as possible the equation of it.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there occurs commotion of teeth to disruption, then strengthen those of which you hope will remain with a thread of gold or silver or lead; and then place on the broken jaw a cerot, and then place on it a doubled cloth, and place on the cloth a large splint made decently, or a piece of sole equal to the length of the jaw; and then tie that bandage according to how you are equipped with the tying of it and that it convenes the application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to use of rest and tranquility, and pause the food of him soft and lean.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that already is altered the figure in any manner, then you yourself untie it on the third day; and then rectify that which is already altered of it and plaster it with powder of meal, with album of egg, or with flour of flaxseed, because you will have obtained the cerot of it, and place on the plaster wool lean.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And therefore as it stands attached and adjusted that plaster on it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave it, that you do not untie it until it is healed and strengthens the fracture; because many times this fracture is straightened in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another time occurs abscess caut, then administer that which we have said many times in the sedation of it until it is healed, and be removed that abscess.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with plague, then consider if it is a piece of the bone separated or splinters, then you yourself subtilize that you remove those splinters with that which you deem appropriate to the removal of those from the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the orifice of the plague is straight, then you enlarge it with the fleubotomizing according to the quantity of your necessity.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then when you will have obtained those splinters, and of those no sir remains removed, then you close the orifice of the plague if it is wide; and if not, place on that one of the plasters that you deem appropriate to it and encase that, until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the clavicle when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the clavicle is broken at the part in front of the muscle, and that fracture is made in one of three manners.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is broken, or separated, or is separated into two parts other that do not occur splinters; and it is easier to the restoration of it; or it is thus that occurs in it splinters, and it is difficult to the restoration of it; or it is thus that the fracture is with plague.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that, when the fracture is with plague, is that you make to be present two ministers, so that one has the adjutori and follows the broken clavicle, and the other extends the neck with that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then encircle the fracture with your fingers until it is made the form of it according to what you deem, and not be in it little eminence nor concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you deem more of extension, then you must place beneath the patient's little finger a support of cloth or wool, and be the greatness of it according to the quantity of your necessity; and extend and elevate the clavicle and fix the support with your hand until you encircle the fracture according to what you deem.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot pull the extremity of the clavicle to the outside parts, because it is reached to the preon, then you must have the patient be supine on his neck, and place on the muscle of him a cushion medium in greatness.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister presses the muscle of him to the inside parts while the bone of the clavicle is elevated that is in the preon in its, and then you rectify the fracture and encircle that with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel splinters of the clavicle and they are bad, then you must do on that and extract those splinters with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you must ingeniously make an incision of it with one of the scissors which you have equipped for it, because you had placed beneath the clavicle the instrument that serves the chisels; and it is an instrument of wood or iron of which this is the form of it:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a culier of which this is the concavity; and be its latitude according to what you have need of it, according to the greatness of the bone or the smallness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Make the length of it according to what is possible for the operation; that there be two extremities thus as often, and one extremity be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the plague which you have incised when you have extracted the splinter from the bone is wide, and it is certain of a purulent caut, then you adjust the two lips of the wound with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear a purulent caut, then you fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the quantity of the wound's cut.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess occurs, then you put a cloth in vinegar and rose oil and wine, and place it over it.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the stricture of the bone when it is the wound and its section, is that you put a plaster made of wheat flour with egg white, and put linen cloth over it, and then put the sphere of it over the little finger of it, if it is necessary of that, and then take a moist cloth, so is the one that has the Saracens, that be very long, and its width of it one palm or around that; and then put doubled powders over the linen cloth and the plaster; and then take a plate of fine wood of which the width of it is three fingers and in length seemingly; and then envelope that in cloth, and then envelope that cloth with the plate in the place over the place of the fracture; and then put moisture as it is revolute, and turn that over the neck of it and over the little finger of it, and over the little finger of the patient, and reduce that over the whole part, and whenever the stricture of the fracture with stricture descends, and this is what is not hidden over you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all, that not be bad the splint over the broken bone; and for so cover that you see the patient every day, that when the ligament is softened or times the splint already be remauguda, then you rectify that and strengthen the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then put the patient's sleep on his neck, and put under the little finger of it, during his sleep at night a small cushion; so that with that, it is elevated the helper of it from the place of that, and therefore is elevated the fracture of the collarbone to elevation of the muscle; or the arm of it tied to the neck of that.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not untie the bandage unless an accident occurs in the place promptly or an abscess, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you have seen the face of it to that, and adjust in the stricture and restore that and leave it until it is restored and coagulated the fracture of the collarbone.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the measure in twenty-eight days, and some times in some men it is done in less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The shoulder blade is broken in the place of its side and not broken from it but its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is broken the place of it — and it is broken in the middle place of it — and it is not known except by touch, then according to what is the figure of the fracture forces you the preparation of it and reduce that according to the natural figure in every manner of ingenuity which is to you possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then put on the place powder of wheat with egg white and linen cloth; and then put powder of doubled cloth; and then put on it a plate of fine wood according to the quantity of the shoulder blade all or maybe a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the plate is concave in some of the places of the shoulder blade, then you fill that concavity with linen cloth, and then raise the plate according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then strengthen above with a long moist cloth with constriction decent and firmness of the plate until it is not remauguda from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the bandage every day; and every time that it is softened, tie another time and strengthen it and equal the plate if it is remauguda from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And put the patient on his side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in twenty days or in twenty-five.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore when this number is completed, then you dissolve the bandage, and that you know for sure that that is of the bones of which the beginning is not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the place of the bone heavy and put under the shoulder, then you divide it over it, and remove it, and do according to what we have said in the fracture of the collarbone of the opening of a purulent caut if it occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot some times is broken in the middle place of it and that tartly; but the extremities of it mot indeve that are cicadas and comminuidas.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents of it when it is broken the middle of it is that it declines to the parts of the feet and occurs to it great pain, and difficulty in the walk, and cough, and fort leu and vomits blood; and it is declared in it cavity in the broken bone and it is not occult to the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that it be resupinated the patient on his back, and put between the shoulder blades of it a cushion; and then press to the muscles of it, and adjust the ribs of it with the hands of two sides, and subtly in the operation of it and in the equating according to every manner that is to it possible and that convenes to it, until it returns the figure of the bone according to what cove.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And place a plaster and lint on it, and place above it a thin board of hazel or of caligae and of their likeness in elevation, because you will wrap that in cloth; and subtilize that in it on the broken bone so that it is not harmful; and go with the bandage according to the roundness of the back some times, and strengthen that with a decent constriction; and consider the bandage at every hour, and when it is softened strengthen that.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity provokes the discharge of that which corrodes or prurience, the pain, the abscess that happens in the place, then you cut and untie that and eradicate the plaster and rectify what happens by that in a manner of cure of it; and then reduce the plaster, sometimes to that which the face; and adjust to it the constriction until it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Of the restoration of the back when it is broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that a fracture of the back does not catch except in thick places that follow the spine; and from the extremities of them of the part before it does not happen to those contortions except by that which they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And knowing of it is not hidden to the feeling, of it is the inquiry by the said ones.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is thus that it aligns the fracture by the said ones according to the manner possible, within that it is engulfed according to that which cove, and then plaster and strengthen the broken bone with that, if it is needed of that.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the back is declining to the parts of the spine, then happens to the patient violent pain and puncture, as puncture that happens to him who has pleurisy, and by that which the bones put the membrane; and happens to him difficulty of handling, and cough, and vomiting of blood; and this is of difficult cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the Antixs are ingenious in that with motz engientz.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And of them it is said: cover that you pause viandas of the patient that engendered inflation and flatulence, for that the belly be inflated and be extended, and the fracture be impelled to the parts outside.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	May we not avoreyssem that for so that it not be cause leugiera to generate abscess caut, if it does not happen; and if it already happens, then helps to that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And diyssero alcus of them that it be paused desus ventoza and that it is sucked with fortitut; and it is similar to ratiocinacio, mays empero it is temut that the ventoza atire the superfluitatz to the place by the debilitat.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And diyssero alcus of them: cover that the place be covered with wool that is already submerged in caut oil, and that pulvils be placed between the ribs within that it be umplified, that it be the bandage aligned when it envelops that according to roundness; and that the patient be cured with cure of pleurisy of food and of medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if cause vehement constrenh the patient which no sufferta, and the bones put the membrane with leading puncture, temem over the patient, then cover that they fenda over the place, discover from the broken rib, and then place over that instrument that conserve the ciphac, the remembrance of which is preceded, and that they inscidam the bones with facilitat, and extract that.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then that they adjust the two lips of the plague, if it is great, with sewing, and cure that with plasters within that it be healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if it happens dedintz abscess, then you cut and enfon pulvils in rozat oil and place over the place, and that the patient be cured with that which cove to the abscess dedintz.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And be ressupinat on the latz on which he sleeps, within that it be healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	Of the restoration of fracture of the spondil of the back and of the neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes it happens that fracture to the bones of the neck, and tart it happens to them attrition, and similarly to the spondils of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And as this happens to some and you want to know if it will heal or no, then consider, for if sometimes their hands are already softened and stupefied and dead and cannot make those nor extend nor strengthen those and when you constrenges those with your said ones or you puncture those with a needle and do not feel in those pain, then you know that it is not healed, and in the worse dispositions it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you feel those and feel constriction with the said ones and puncture, then you know that the neck of the bone is saved and that the patient will recover with cure.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see in the spondils of the neck the semblance to that and you want to know if it will heal or no, then consider the feet of him.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you see that they are already mollified, it happens to those that happens in the hands, and when he lays upon his back, he feels flatulence and egestio ses his will, and sometimes he is ressupinat on his back and wants to urinate and cannot, then you know that it is mortal, and therefore do not work in the cure of him.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if it does not happen any cause of those, the cause is better and pus lighter.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the cure of it is that you perforses to the sedation of the abscess caut that you place over the spondil atrissat oil rozat sol, or with mugols of huous asatz; place over that some times the day within that it be sedated the abscess caut.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then place one of the comforting and existing plasters, and press it firmly on that limb; and command the patient to use rest and tranquility and that he does not sleep on the part with which he feels pain until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens that the fracture of the bone has separated or any cause that has already separated from it, then cover it with a bandage and hold that bone; and then adjust the two lips of the wound, with sutures if it is large; and then take care of it with some ointment of the herbs, until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the bone of the heel is broken, and it is the end of the foot, then cover it with a bandage and hold that bone with the other hand according to the second equation; and then place a plaster and bandage on it, if you need those, and press it firmly.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel broken bones in it, then you put your hand on it, and hold it, and cure the wound with the cure that was preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the Restoration of the Womb.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the womb are broken, and if they break, then the fracture of them is nothing but a communication at the extremities of those and are incised in the length and decline to the sides; and it happens to the patient pain in the place and puncture, and the leg is stunned when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over it while it is over the fracture which is the figure of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is at the extremity of it, then you hold it according to how it is apparelled to you by equation hold until it is assembled to its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the long or which already declines to the sides, then you make the patient lie on their belly until it is prepared to you the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And therefore when you have held it, place a plaster on it, and then place a bandage of cloth or bandage on it, and press firmly so that there is no fear of puncture of fracture or removal of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And hold the cavity with water that fills it while that pregna the stricture according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on their back or on their side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if it happens that a boil occurs, then you cease from extension of it and its restoration until the boil is settled, and place on it water that sits it according to what was preceded; and then return to the restoration of it, and press it as you covered.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if it happens in the bones or they are comminuted, then you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	Of the Restoration of the Fracture of the Adductor.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	Adductor is that which is between the hip to the top of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then the restoration of it is in one of two ways, of which is the one that you take a splint of medium thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And tie in two extremities two bandages, and then have it suspended from the elevated place.
