E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient on a chair; and then throw out their broken arm over the splint until it reaches the tip of it in the middle place of which is annexed the curvature of the splint.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend over it some heavy cause, or the minister extends it to the sides; and then the doctor and which the fracture with his hands together, until the fracture returns according to how it covered.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient be resupinated on his neck and suspend the arm of his collar with a bandage; and then command two ministers that one of them holds that which is above the fracture with his hands; and the other holds the pus below it; and whichever of them extends to their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be more strong, then you press over the fracture with a bandage and over that with another bandage, and whichever of the two ministers extends to their two parts.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And therefore if the fracture is proximate to the extremity of the muscle, then it should be placed half of the bandage over the collarbone and the other below the fracture of the hip.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly if the fracture is proximate to the hip, then it should be placed the bandage over that place and over that hip.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Hold that with ease and work, and as long as it is held according to how it covered and is applied for good application, then press it if it does not happen that a boil occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if it happens that a boil occurs, then lay off the splint within the seventh day, and place over it wool cloth soaked in vinegar and olive oil until it rests the boil, and then you press it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way of pressing it is that you place a plaster over the fracture, and then place a covering of new cloth over the plaster; and then adjust the arm over that adductor, and place your hand over their muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and press over the adductor the arm so that the arm be in place of splints, if it does not prohibit from that any cause of the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use stars.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you pause on the fracture that star which is pus thicker and pus stronger than the other stars; and pause between each star the width of the finger, and let the length of the stars according to the fracture with the addition of three fingers of all part.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen over the stars with the structure which I have said at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your structure over the place of the fracture be pus straight.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And as much as the fracture is longer, the structure is less.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And therefore if you see the situation of the stars and the structure as we have said in the hour in which you restore the limb to its position, then you do.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear abscess caut, then you leave the structure and the stars inside for seven days as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that it does not happen in the place proximity or inflammation; or it is forbidden the food to arrive at the limb by disposition of superfluity of structure; and therefore rectify all that according to what we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are over confidence that no cause of this happens, then do not untie the bandage until after three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient's sleep on their back, and their hands be on their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And put on the adjuvant cooked full of wool evenly, and consider at every hour of the night or day that the figure of the broken limb be not loosened or dissolved, or that the ligament be softened, therefore rectify that all with your virtue.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And put the patient's food according to the order which we have before said, so that the food be subtle at the beginning until it is begun to strengthen; and then when it thickens the food of him.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	Because of custom of the adjuvant and the bandage of it is that they be strengthened in forty days; and then when they are untied and be administered bath and be medicated with poultices which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is laid rubbed, then you do not untie that the ligament and the stars inside for a day or inside two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	Arm is composed of two bones which are called two focils; of which one is small, and that is the one that sits the little finger, and the other is large and is the one that is placed below the little finger, from the part further down.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And often the major focil is broken alone, or the small one, and often they are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small focil is broken above, then the restoration of it is lighter, and the healing of it is lighter.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the focil of it is broken below the fracture of it is bad, and the healing of it is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse of that is when the two bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore if the bone which is broken is the small focil above, then it is convenient to the doctor, must the restoration of it, that pause little extension with facility until that be evened.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the large focil is that which is broken, then it must pause extension more vehement.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if the two focils are together broken, then it must you pause the extrusion more strong.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And must you pause the figure of the hand, you must the restoration of it and the extension of it extended over a cushion, and be the wrist of the hand to the parts above, more high than all the other fingers, and the little finger be lower than the other fingers, and the patient be centered on a chair fallen.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And be a cushion in front of him in the altitude or upright of him, so that the patient does not lean work.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And then the minister extends the arm from the part below with his hand or ligament, and another minister extends above seemingly.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And then the doctor evens the bones while reducing that according to the best figure that he can.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the fracture of the bone there are splinters, then you pierce to reduce all pieces in their place with your virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears in it a splinter separated that pierces the code and is not to your hope in the restoration of it, then you finish over it and oust that according to the manner which we have said above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is with plague, you have already done to this chapter singular, and therefore take the cure of that.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if there happens abscess caut at the beginning of your restoration, then you line a cloth with cerot made of rose oil and white wax, and be middle between subtlety and thickness, and strengthen cloth over that with subtle structure until the abscess is ceded; and then remove the cerot and pause plaster prepared of powder of mill with clayre of egg, and then pause stars; and be the star which is paused over that fracture pus thicker and pus stronger.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And know that the number of the stars of the arm are six in the major dispositions, or be the fracture in one focil or in two focils together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	And then place your bandage over the fracture site with force and vehemence, and when the bandage is tighter on the parts above the fracture or the parts below it, place the bandage a little looser according to what was said in the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths that are wrapped over the fracture should be soft and moist cloths, and not hard or rough, and the thread with which it is tightened should be of its own proper middle between fine and coarse, as we have recounted.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the limb and the ligament for a few days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause occurs for which rectification is necessary, as if the swelling occurs in the limb, then you must immerse the limb in warm water until the swelling ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And let the limb not be constrained until it rests, and then return the bandage.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the bandage is already softened and the bone is already set and seems like that, then rectify all of it with your virtue.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider more if the nourishment is prevented from reaching the limb by excess of bandage, for then you must soften that a little and let it for a few days until nourishment runs to it, and then tighten it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if the patient does not experience any of the causes we have mentioned, then he should not be unbandaged for about 20 days or thereabouts.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And then the arm of the patient should be suspended by its own virtue of movement, and make him sleep on his back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or 32 days, or very soon it is restored in 28 days, and all of this is according to the disposition of the complexities and the dispositions of the virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the thumb and fingers.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	Know that in the thumb and fingers, a fracture is rarely found, and it does not happen to them except for a few times.

Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	But if the fracture is in the outer parts, then you must place a splint above and another splint from the inside part of the palm, so that the hand is open and straight; and then place the bandage, as if the hand is turned to the wrist between the fingers and ligaments.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if a fracture occurs to one of the knuckles of the fingers, then if the finger is straight, it should be aligned according to what is necessary and then tightened with the palm, and if you wish, place a small straight splint on it so that the fracture is elevated and not damaged.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	But if the fracture is in the other fingers, as in the middle finger, or the index, or the ring finger, or the little finger, then it should be aligned and tied with the finger that is next to it; or all of them should be tied according to continuity, and that is better; or place a small splint on it, as we have said in the thumb.

Capitol .xiv.	Chapter XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the bone of the hip.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the hip is rarely broken and is declared to the feeling according to how it is converted to the front part and to the most sovereign part.

The stricture of him is made thus: so that a hard bandage is wrapped over the fracture, and that is folded two or three times, and the superfluity is removed; and then the leg is wrapped up until it reaches the bone and the root of the thigh.

E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill the spaces between the leg and thigh with soft cloths, so that the stricture is coagulated.

And then begin with a strong splint on the place of the fracture with three or four wrappings, and the more you move away with the splint from the place of the fracture, the less your splint is and softer and more moist.

And then leave the splint on him, so that no corrosion or abscess or inflammation or similar things occur to the limb; and if any of those things occur, then cut the splint from him, and correct what has occurred again, as we have said many times.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if in the bone is heavy the bone which you put, then you must straighten it as much as is possible; and if not, then break over it and remove that, and cure with that of which the remembrance precedes until it is healed.

Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the leg.

Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the talus and the bones of the foot and of the said.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio. E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And then strengthen that with the foot in structure descent, because that you have enveloped that with cloths and with other causes of which I indigeys.

And it is convenient to you that you do not forget that you do not consider all the causes which I have said to you in the other fractures of the accidents that we have said; and oppose yourself to every accident with that which cove.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter .xviii.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of fracture of the hip of the woman and of the bone of the thigh and of the groin of the man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras. And then place poultices upon the back of it, and when it wants to urinate, remove the cot with facility and then urine, and reduce and return that according to the manner according to which you have seen that at the beginning, and then return to its first poultice.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do thus for seven days or around those, because that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you want, take a bladder of sheep and strengthen upon the trough of it a tube of cane; and introduce the whole bladder into the hip of it, and then puff into the tube with virtue within that the bladder be inflated within the hip, because the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then be filled with cot and stay for some days according to that we have recommitted, within that it be healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the thigh of man or woman is broken, then administer in the restoration and splicing of it that which we have recommitted in the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And that which is straight is not hidden in these proper fractures and that few become, mostly to that one who is some study and use and understands this my book well; because that fracture signifies to you in the major dispositions via right in the restoration and in the structure of it, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the groin of the man when it is broken, take a guard of oak, and put the groin in it; and then place upon it wrapping of cloth, and it be enveloped, and then let it be left for three days or around those, and it be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .xix.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of restoration of fractures of the bones when it is with plague.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	Convenient is to that one who has occurred fracture with plague, and mostly if the bone is large as it is the bone of the thigh or of the arm, or similar to that, that you take care of and fleubotomize it as soon as the conditions of fleubotomia to you or testify as above we have said.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the plague flows blood, then you must strive to retain it so that you pulverize over it three times, if no other cause is present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And about to start restoring the fracture in that same day, and do not prolong it, if not you will get an abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess occurs, then you leave the restoration of it until the ninth day, until the abscess has subsided, and do not approach it on the third day and the fourth of all, for you will cause further accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is prominent over the uncovered tendon, then you must strive to reduce it and align it with your hands with ease and with little extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if the extension is not to your prepared and the alignment of it with your hands, then you reduce it with your hands with this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, the length of which is of seven digits or eight and the width of which is according to the quantity of the plague; and for this it is necessary for the physician to prepare of those three or four according to the quantity that indicates to this in the cure in all species of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be round, and in it little thickness so that it not be bent, the comprehension over it in the hour of the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should be of sharp extremity at which it is margin in its extremities; and the use of it to a thickness tending, and of the majority of it within to the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek “labre volentz atelarem”, so it is the small palette.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that the extremity of it may be placed elevated over the extremity of the bone prominent.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And impel it in one movement while the bone returns, and it is aligned with some alignment.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore strive to align the extremities of the fracture between them, and if the extremity of the broken bone is subtle, and does not take that the instrument for good acceptance, then you must insert the extremity of that bone while the instrument has power over it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone of all with what we have recommended, then cut it with what you convey to it of the incisors which we have said; or saw it with one of the saws in whatever manner it is possible to you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then smooth that which remains in the bone of asperities and of small scales.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And as the bone is reduced, and after the reduction the patient suffers vehement pain, then you know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do what you confer to the patient great benefit.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When is completed the restoration which you do to the bone, and then submerge a cloth in black stiptic wine, and properly if it is in summer, and do not place over the plague cerot or other cause in which there is oil, so that it does not cause in it to occur puss and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And after the administration of stelas in the hour of your compliment of the restoration of the bone, and leave the plague uncovered so that you cut the trauc with forceps and uses of bandages according to the quantity of the plague.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And guard yourself with all caution that you do not strain the plague with the fracture, for many times have done this the foolish physicians, and have caused to occur over their patients death or sickness corrupt or gangrene, so it is healed.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if your stricture lighter, soft, different from the stricture of the other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the plague is great or is a bad plague, and you fear over that some accidents worse than the ones we have recommended, and you suffer pain in the place, then you must not place over it stelas, but make to that wrapping of hard cloths in place of stelas and strain it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when after a day or two the plague begins, that in it be generated a brac, then you remove the cloth which you had placed over it with wine, and then administer calguas, ointments with which of our custom is that we medicate the plagues, as such as tetrafarmacon and similar to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it convenes to you that you untie the liament and consider the plague in each day morning and evening until it is consolidated and fixed, and that the member be prepared in such manner that the puss runs from it to the parts below with facilitated.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If to the plague pass many days, and it is not consolidated nor is abscindit from it the brac, then you know that here are satagias of the small ones for which you must inquire the plague with a tenta.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those satagias those that are separated remove and extract, those that of them are not separated and put the member and cause to occur pain, pierce yourself to cut those according to you that is possible.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if there occurs to the plague zuchem or eluchen, so it is stiomenios, or another species of corruption and putrefaction, then you must place to each of those with what convenes to it of the cure of which is preceded narration in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of this in which you must know the best sermon and you make present your pessa: when the bone is broken, emerges over the member as the bone of the hip and the auxiliary and similar to those of the large members, and that you do not presume traction of it, nor the extraction of it for many times accidents occur by that death; have left that within until you can, for very soon it will fall by itself after twenty days or thirty. And then treat the plague if you see it, and if not leave it.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .xx.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the cure of the swelling that occurs in the region of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Often this swelling occurs in the region of the healing of a fracture, and most often it is near the joints, and it is disfigured by it the figure of the limb; and very often it forbids the limb from its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Therefore consider if the swelling is recent and administer in that those medicines that have stipulated as such as aloe, and incense, and mira, and wormwood, and similar to those; in such a way that you take some of those or all of them, and combine those with vi stiptic, or with album of egg, or with vi agre, and place that over the swelling in a cloth, and bind those over it with a good constriction.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And leave the constriction that does not untie that for many days; and then untie that and iterate another, until the swelling is reduced; or strengthen over that a plate of lead, because lead has the property of reducing everything that is inflated in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the swelling has already been converted into a fester and it is necessary to provoke to drain that wound, then cut that open along the most sovereign part of it, and incise the superfluity and eminence, or drain that with some reeds until it is reduced; and cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of the restoration of a fracture when it is restored and then the limb becomes subtle and flexible again according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is restored, and then the limb becomes subtle and flexible again, then this is not done except for many causes: of which one is the multitude of solution of the ligament and of the ligament of it made not according to what it should be; or for superfluity of constriction of the ligaments while the nourishment is prohibited from running to the limb; or for multitude of superfluous embrocation; or for superfluous movement not at the right time; or for lack of blood in the body of the patient and for weakness of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the cure of this is to give the patient to eat and make the heart of him tender until the blood is multiplied in him; and administer baths; and bring joy and cheerfulness over him.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then place a poultice on the limb, so that the poultice attracts nourishment to it, or continue embrocation of it with warm water, until the nourishment runs and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .xxii.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the cure of broken bones when they are restored crookedly and forbid the operation of them as they should.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When it happens to the limb already restored during the healing of it from crookedness and eminence in the broken bone and swelling, and it is because of this that the form of the limb is flawed, but however the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation, then it is not necessary that you receive the word of that one who exists that member be of a new fracture.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But already there have been many foolish physicians and restorers who have done this in our land; and this operation is very blameworthy, causing great fear, the sign of which is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if lameness and swelling are recent, then it is necessary that they be embrocated with warm water in which are placed softening herbs, such as are the leaves of altea and roots of it, and melilot, and similar to those; and make a poultice with a softening poultice such as diallaquilon well made; or that which is prized mulch of altea root and is contused with gray of dove or with oil of camomile, and be plastered with it; or that which are prized fat figs and are triturated with dove's dung, and similar to those of the medicines that are called amermans consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved with assiduous light friction that is with the moist hands, and be administered movement of the limb to all parts at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if crookedness has already gone ahead and is made very strong and converted into a fester, and it is necessary to cure it with iron, then it is necessary that it be the most used, and the continuation of the bone is dissolved, and be incised that which superfluity of swelling of that part with the bone with subtle scissors, and be administered facility in that with solicitude and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter .xxiii.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of the treatment of dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of any of the joints from its place, so that it is prohibited from movement, and the figure of the limb is disfigured, and it brings upon the patient pains and great injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when it happens to someone a dislocation, then it is necessary to immediately perforate that it be reduced, and not delay that reduction, because if it is delayed, the place is apostematized and very much with that it is made difficult the reduction of dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this, it is not necessary that it be bad or stretched in the hour of the apostematization, because many times it brings spasms and terrible pains.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, then it is necessary that you get to the flaubotomia of the patient, and then let it rest until the apostematize rests; and then the limb be embrocated with warm water and oil, and then be reduced with facility.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every member be cured with this, of which the memory will come back in its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you already have ordered the capitals of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the part of the body most sovereign to the part most left.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the jaw left.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So dislocated are the two jaws if no tart; and the dislocation of both is made in one of two ways: that or they are remaugulated from their places by little movement, and are softened a little; or they are dislocated by entire dislocation and complicated, until they are softened at the junction, until saliva of the patient flows and that he cannot have that nor can he close his mouth, and the tongue of him be enveloped in his word.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of him is little, then in the major dispositions it returns by itself with little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is entire and complicated, then it is necessary that it be administered reduction of it lightly, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister has the head of the patient, and the doctor inserts his finger of one hand into the root of the dislocation of the jaw from within his mouth, if the dislocation is of one part; or that he inserts his two fingers together, if the dislocation is of two parts, and the others of his hands are outside with which he grasps; and he commands the patient to cease his jaws and let those go from each part; and the doctor grasps the jaw and pushes the jaw until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if it is difficult the reduction of it, and most if both the jaws are dislocated at once, then administer vaporization with hot water and oil, until it is made lighter the reduction of both and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And therefore when they return and are grasped, and the mouth of the patient is closed and is not softened, then place over those powders of cloth with cerot, and it is made of wax and oil rubbed; and then it is laid with ease with linen molds.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the sleep of the patient on his two sides, and the head of him be standing between two pillows, so that he does not hurt that to the right part nor to the left; and do not let him by force chew any cause; having his food be forbidden leon, until when the pains are remaugulated and the jaws are nozzled, then let him chew what he wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this be administered with ease, and do not work on the opening of the mouth of the patient, the eating and drinking and spitting, until the jaw be nozzled and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult the reduction of two jaws when they are dislocated at any hour and are not converted to their places, then many times accidents happen fevers and continuous soda, and very much is alerted the belly of the patient, and very much and vomits pure colera.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then you know that it is pernicious; and many times dies that one to whom this accident happens in X days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the collarbone and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The collarbone is not dislocated from the place from within by its continuation with the feet; and sometimes it is dislocated at the outward part, and this is declared to the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient lies on his two sides and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then grasp the place with your palm with strong grasping, so that it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then place over that plaster and powders and strengthen that.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which seizes the shoulder and is continued with it, is not dislocated in any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and grasped according to what we have said and according to what is to your apparel.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then place over that plaster, and powders, and constriction, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until it be healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this same cure is reduced the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated but according to three manners, of which one is that it is dislocated at the part of the upper arm to the part below.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the part above the muscle, and this is made tart; and it is not dislocated at the parts behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated at the parts in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and outside it is emitted to the parts below the upper arm, and mostly in those whose flesh is few, it is dislocated lightly; but in those in which there are many flesh, it is emitted outside with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And very much happens to some men by percussion or fall, and the muscle of him is apostate of apostate caut, and it is cured for that which already is dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore it is necessary that you suppose this while you are over-serious about him, and then you process in the cure of him.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of the limb is known when it is at the sides of the thigh; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy muscle, because you find between those different manifestations; and you find at the head of the muscle a concavity and at the sides of the thigh the touch of the head of the muscle as if it were a ball, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his armpit, nor move that for all movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated, you touch the foot or leg, and then you find a manifest touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation is made light reduction when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister elevates the hand of him to the sides below; and then places his thumbs below the thigh of him, and elevates the joint with strength upwards to its place, and the minister elevates the hand of him, and extends that upwards; and then places that below where it returns slightly.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if for what we have said it does not return, and it is from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, many days, then it happens that the patient is bathed in warm water and is administered a poultice that softens and liniments as if it were cooked roots of  mallow, and fennel, and melilot in water, and is administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient is laid on his back and placed below the thigh of him waiting for the wool that is equal between levitation and constriction, and then the physician places his heel on the sphere, and elevates the head of the muscle with virtue, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it is not bad to the sides, and another minister holds the head of the patient, so that it is not bad to the sides, because that instantly returns to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce it this way: and it is that you make present a man who is longer than the patient, and is on the side of that leg, and interposes his muscle below the thigh of the patient and elevates the thigh of him to the sides while the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the sides of his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then it happens that with him that another cause is suspended, so that the heavy one, because the dislocation returns instantly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced easily in another way: and it is that a long rod is placed on the ground, the head of which is round in figure, as if it were a mortar, that it is not thick nor thin, and then it is placed below the patient; because when it is placed on the head of the rod cloths are placed, and the patient is standing according to the length of the rod, and then the hand of him is extended to the sides of the other part; and the body of him is extended from the other part with strength, because the joint returns to its place with speed.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult reduction of it for all the causes that we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a rod the quantity of which is in the length of two arms, and its width is four digits, and the thickness of it is eased in the middle of the thigh according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And on the rounded head, cloths are placed so that the rod does not injure the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then it is placed below the thigh of the patient, and the hand or arm is extended over the rod between the sides, and the rod is tied over the assistant and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then the arm is placed on a step of a ladder according to the width, and the hand is extended to the sides, and the other body is suspended from the other side, because the joint enters instantly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And as the entry of it is completed according to whichever manner that is possible to you, and then it happens that you place below the thigh a sphere of wool of equal quantity; and then place a plaster prepared of powder of ground with eggs and album of hen over the whole muscle, as if it were rolled upwards, and then strength below the thigh with decent constriction; and the bandage is rolled over the plaster, and the hand of him is attached to the neck of him, and is left, and the hand of him is not moved for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it happens that the food of the patient is placed little, while the limb is comforted, because it is lighter to the healing of it.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food is given more after seven or five and is exercised a movement; and therefore if it is stopped and is not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times because of humidity that happens to it or for another cause, then it happens that in that one is administered cautery with three burns, according to that which was said before in the chapter of cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after seven days the bandage is loosened and the joint is not fixed, and the plaster and constriction are reduced over it several times, and it is not fixed and catz and cannot elevate that arm to the sides, then you know that the nerves of him, which are at the head of the muscle, are already cut or extended or softened, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Of the dislocation of that which is made of the foot and the thigh or the parts behind, the reduction is made with impulse and extension with the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And the other constriction should be administered in that, and take care of that until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it happens that healing gravitates in the limb and slowness in its movement, then the patient uses baths, many times, until that heaviness is relieved and it returns to its first nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .xxvii.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the hip joint is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated to all parts, and more so in the front part than in the back part, and the dislocation of it is not known until it is touched or felt, according to which figure it is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip to its place, this is declared to you manifestly, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch with its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And cover that hip, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before an abscess comes to it, because if it comes to an abscess, it is difficult to reduce it, and it is not healed of all; and especially when it is in the back part, because it is the worst of all kinds of dislocations, and of greater pain, and many times they leave to it death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand of it be extended with two fingers, and the arm of it be expanded, and the hands of the physician be over the hip and below it, and he pushes the joint with the tips of his fingers, or at the root of his palm, until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front part, then it returns as if you bend the hand with your hand, until you strike the hip with the root of your palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer vehement extension and strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that elevation of the ministers so that it is not removed from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then, having revolved the arm completely, because it is enveloped in a long folded cloth over the hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, anoint it with some oil so that this is the cause of those which help in the lubrication of the joint with facility; and then push the joint with a vehement impulse until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And after the reduction of it, cover it so that it be placed upon that plaster in which there is stiffness and application of egg white, and be extended with a descending bandage, and the arm be suspended from the neck, and be left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And after it is loosened; and therefore if the joint is formed in its place, then you untie the bandage of it and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if sometimes the joint does not become stronger, then you repeat the plaster and bandage, and leave it for some days until it is extended; and after it is loosened.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to it heaviness after the reduction of the joint, and the disposition of it is in movement, then administer moisture in baths and subtle friction, and compression, until it is relieved; or rest upon the joint relieved, so it is a cushion of greasy motion; and then be bound, and leave it over the bones day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And after you have placed it, and put it in a bath; and when it is dry, then you rub the joint with temperate friction, and then repeat upon it the cushion, so it is a cushion of motion, once, and the second, and the third,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already arrived on the tooth inside the mouth, while it is still lining.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, place upon it a piece of damp cowhide scraped with border and strengthen upon it; and do this several times, because it is moist and reduces it to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the cure of dislocation of the wrist, that is, of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Wrist dislocation sometimes occurs, and the reduction of its dislocation is lighter, and the opposite is true of other joints, but however, cover that it is velocity in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is dislocated, before the place is suppurated or that which happens in it suppuration.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the hand of the patient upon a table and the minister extends the hand of that, and the physician places his hand or his palm upon the prominence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But however, cover that it is considered if the palm is already placed on the back of the hand, then the patient places the back of his hand upon a table with the extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preceding of the back of the hand, then be the position of the hand of that intrinsically upon the table, so that the hand of the physician sits upon that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore if it returns quickly, it is good; and if not, then strengthen it with a bandage yielding the suppuration and leave it; and do not repeat this, because if not, it does not suffer nor can you upon the reduction of it more than passing to it days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But the joint is straightened according to its crookedness; and no cause is given to the patient, except that the hand is softened and cannot tighten any cause; then you know that the nerves are cut or torn, and then there is no need for it except to tighten it with a cautery near the place of it and firmly apply water to it, and give no cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, when the bad flesh is returned, then place a poultice on it which we have prepared, and let it be left and tightened for 5 days; and then remove it and let it be left and the hand of it be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is stayed and there is any heaviness in it, then gently moisten it with warm water and with friction several times, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure of dislocations of the joints.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes joints are dislocated in every part.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a finger is dislocated of those in the palm of the hand or on the back of it, then straighten the finger and impel the dislocation of it with the thumbs, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend that part to which it is dislocated, and let it be for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend that until it is straight and equal in that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night comes, tie that according to that narration, and do not cease to untie that in the day and exercise with movement, and tie that at night; and do this for some days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similar with this, if it is dislocated on the back of the hand, and tie that to that part and do with this your first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do with this when it is dislocated in the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of dislocations of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When there occurs to any of the vertebrae of the back or of the neck a complicated dislocation, and the movable vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that there is no cure, because death seizes the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the digestion of the patient is outside of its will, and it cannot retain that; and many times are softened some limbs of it or two legs of it or two arms of it, or one of those; or is removed a vertebra from its place, because many times is removed and many times is made the removal of those in four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, that is already removed to the rear parts and is called gelbozit.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure of it is that then you consider if the gelbozit occurs from puerility, because then in that there is no cure nor is there healing of all.
